0.title: 20-yr-old kills self after failing to clear Agniveer test in Uttarakhand
0.article_body: A 20-year-old man from Uttarakhand's Bageshwar allegedly killed himself after consuming poison following his failure in clearing the Agniveer recruitment test, the police said. "I have no other option left. I did a lot of hard work. I was rejected from the race despite having an NCC 'C' certificate," he said in a video he made before killing himself.

1.title: B'luru man accuses wife of 'regularly' beating him, complains to PMO
1.article_body: A Bengaluru-based man has accused his wife of beating him regularly and filed a complaint with Prime Minister's Office (PMO), seeking help and protection. "Would anyone help me?...No, because I'm a man! My wife attacked me with knife, is this...naari shakti you boost about?" he tweeted. He tagged PMO, Bengaluru Police Commissioner and Law Minister Kiren Rijiju in the tweet.

2.title: Punjab to have 16 new medical colleges in 5 years: CM Bhagwant Mann
2.article_body: The Punjab government will build 16 new medical colleges in the next five years in the state, Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said. This will take the number of government medical colleges in the state to 25, he added. The government has begun a massive recruitment drive to fill all the vacant posts in the health department, Mann stated.

3.title: Nursing staff of Delhi government hospitals on strike from 2 to 4 Nov
3.article_body: The nursing staff of various hospitals run by the Delhi government went on a strike on Wednesday over demands like regularisation of services and long-due promotions. Delhi Nurses Federation (DNF) said the "symbolic strike" would take place from 9-11 am from November 2-4. "Emergency and ICU services won't be affected as nominal staff will work," DNF stated.

4.title: Belgium-based firm SettleMint raises $16 million in Series A round
4.article_body: SettleMint, a Belgium-based blockchain application development program has secured $16 million in a Series A funding round that was co-led by Molten Ventures and OTB Ventures. Other investors like Fujitsu Ventures, Allusion and Bloccelerate and existing investors including Medici Ventures also participated in the funding round. Matthew Van Niekerk and Roderik van der Veer founded the company.

5.title: Shouldn't be taken lightly: Pilot on PM Modi's praise for Gehlot
5.article_body: A day after PM Narendra Modi praised Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, Congress leader Sachin Pilot said that it is a "very interesting" development that "should not be taken lightly" by the party. "The PM had similarly praised Ghulam Nabi Azad in Parliament. We saw what happened after that," he added. PM Modi visited Mangarh Dham in Rajasthan on Tuesday.

6.title: Hyd school shut over 4-yr-old's rape to remain open for this academic year
6.article_body: The Telangana government allowed a DAV school in Hyderabad to function till the end of the academic year, after revoking the school's licence, following a four-year-old girl's alleged rape by the principal's driver. Parents requested that the school be allowed to function under a different management. An order said that teachers against whom there were complaints would be removed.

7.title: JSW Group plans to invest ₹1 lakh crore in Karnataka: Chairman
7.article_body: JSW Group Chairman Sajjan Jindal said the group is planning to invest ₹1 lakh crore in Karnataka over the next five years. Speaking at the 'Invest Karnataka 2022', he also requested the state government to consider mineral auctions. He said the investment would be directed towards the expansion of its steel plant, and renewable energy and port infrastructure development space.

8.title: Was in ICU: Rajinikanth on not attending Puneeth Rajkumar's funeral
8.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth said that he couldn't attend Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar's funeral due to his health condition around the same time. "I had undergone an operation and was in the intensive care unit (ICU)," Rajinikanth shared. Rajinikanth and Jr NTR were present at the 67th Kannada Rajyotsava where Puneeth was posthumously conferred with Karnataka's highest civilian award, Karnataka Ratna.

9.title: Hyd police collect fingerprints from commuters, say it prevents crimes
9.article_body: In Hyderabad, policemen are stopping commuters and coercing them into submitting their fingerprints on a device. Balanagar, Assistant Commissioner of Police A Gangaram, said that this exercise was being conducted to identify offenders and prevent crimes. He added that biometrics of citizens were not being collected, instead the portable device was matching fingerprints with the existing database.

10.title: India record their highest-ever T20I total against Bangladesh
10.article_body: India on Wednesday recorded their highest-ever T20I total against Bangladesh after registering 184/6 in 20 overs in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Adelaide. India's previous highest T20I total against Bangladesh had come on June 6, 2009, when they recorded 180/5 in Nottingham. Virat Kohli top-scored for India today with 64*(44).

11.title: Court convicts 41 persons in 2005 Balrampur riots case, 1 convict flees
11.article_body: A court has sentenced 41 persons to five years of imprisonment in connection with the 2005 Balrampur riots in Uttar Pradesh in which at least a dozen people were injured. Notably, one of the convicts managed to escape on the day of the judgement. The accused, who were out on bail, were taken into custody following the verdict.

12.title: Arab League leaders meet in Algeria after 3 years, focus on 'Palestinian cause'
12.article_body: Leaders of Arab countries met at the 31st Arab League summit in Algerian capital, Algiers on Monday, for the first time in three years. Algerian President Abdelmadjid Tebboune said "exceptional global conditions are creating polarisation...which is impacting our food security," without mentioning Russian invasion of Ukraine. "Our central and primary cause remains the Palestinian cause," he added.

13.title: Maha man fraudulently claims GST refund of over ₹27 crore, arrested
13.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested in Maharashtra on Tuesday for fraudulently claiming a GST refund of more than ₹27 crore. A GST official said the man had facilitated the opening of at least two "non-genuine" companies, which availed fake input tax credit worth over ₹34 crore and claimed the refund. These companies had issued bogus bills of over ₹238 crore.

14.title: We prevented a complete downturn of the economy: RBI Governor Das
14.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das said the central bank has "prevented a complete downturn of the economy". Das added that the debate over RBI being behind the curve in tightening monetary policy was over. "We wanted the economy to safely reach the shores, and thereafter try and pull down inflation," he further said.

15.title: SC rejects plea against Justice Chandrachud becoming CJI, calls it 'misconceived'
15.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday dismissed a plea against the appointment of Justice DY Chandrachud as the next CJI, saying the petition was "misconceived". During the hearing in the matter, the petitioner's counsel cited some "irregularities and illegal acts" allegedly committed by Justice Chandrachud. The bench, led by CJI UU Lalit, said, "We see no reason to entertain this petition."

16.title: Seychelles-based crypto firm Huobi Global rejects mass layoff rumours: Report
16.article_body: Seychelles-based crypto exchange Huobi Global has called "large-scale layoff" reports "untrue" and rejected allegations that two of its top executives resigned, Cointelegraph reported. This comes after Chinese journalist Colin Wu claimed that the company's CEO and CFO resigned, and that it is preparing for "large-scale" layoffs. "Some cost-cutting could be on the cards," a spokesperson added.

17.title: In a first, men's washroom in Mumbai Metro to have diaper-changing facility
17.article_body: Mumbai Metro is all set to become the first metro rail service in India to have men's washrooms with diaper-changing facilities. All 26 stations in Metro 3 from Cuffe Parade to SEEPZ will have this facility. "Our intent is...to not [cause] inconvenience [to] children and their parents while changing their diapers," a spokesperson from Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation said.

18.title: World considers India as bright spot: PM at Invest Karnataka Summit
18.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said despite world going through a phase of "global crisis", world considers India as a "bright spot" as we continue our initiatives to strengthen fundamentals of our economy. "Free trade deals that have been signed give world a glimpse of our preparedness," PM Modi said during his virtual inaugural address at Invest Karnataka 2022 Summit.

19.title: Teaser of 'Pathaan' released on Shah Rukh Khan's 57th birthday
19.article_body: The teaser of Siddharth Anand-directorial 'Pathaan' was released on the occasion of Shah Rukh Khan's 57th birthday on Wednesday. "Fasten your seatbelts...Pathaan teaser out now," Shah Rukh wrote while sharing the teaser on Instagram. The film also stars Deepika Padukone and John Abraham. It is scheduled to release on January 25, 2023.

20.title: Will of God: Accused on Gujarat's Morbi bridge collapse that killed 135 people
20.article_body: Deepak Parekh, one of the Oreva Group managers arrested in Gujarat's Morbi bridge collapse case, told the court that it was "the will of God" that the incident took place. Oreva was responsible for the maintenance of the bridge which collapsed, resulting in the loss of 135 lives. Parekh is one of the nine people arrested in the case.

21.title: 2,000 people buy QR code tickets for B'luru metro on 1st day of rollout
21.article_body: Nearly 2,000 people reportedly bought QR code tickets via WhatsApp and the Namma Metro application to use Bengaluru metro on Tuesday, which was the first day of the scheme's rollout. The system enables commuters to ride the metro without using tokens or smart cards. Commuters can now select their origin and drop destinations on the app and purchase single-trip tickets.

22.title: All smartphones except iPhones to get 5G from mid-November: Airtel CEO
22.article_body: Bharti Airtel's CEO Gopal Vittal has said that all 5G-enabled smartphones, except Apple's iPhones, will start supporting Airtel 5G services by the middle of November. He said that Apple will release the software update needed to support 5G in the first week of November. All of the Apple devices should support the 5G services by mid-December, the Airtel CEO added.

23.title: India has UPI AutoPay to collect 'blue tick' fees: NPCI CEO to Twitter
23.article_body: Amid a debate over Elon Musk's decision to charge Twitter users $8/month for 'blue ticks', National Payments Corporation of India's (NPCI) MD and CEO Dilip Asbe has pitched the UPI AutoPay to take care of the monthly payments. Responding to Musk's tweet, Asbe wrote, "No worries, India has UPI AutoPay...to collect every anytime/month/quarter or yearly as you wish dear Twitter".

24.title: MP teacher holds liquor, non-veg food party in school, suspended
24.article_body: A government school teacher was suspended for alleged violation of service conduct rules after he held a party where liquor and non-vegetarian food were served on school premises in MP’s Shivpuri, an official said. A video of the party went viral on social media. There had been complaints about him holding such parties regularly on school premises, official stated.

25.title: 3 new model corridors to come up in Hyderabad: Report
25.article_body: The western part of Hyderabad will get three new model corridors as the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is likely to approve the proposal this week, reports said. The corridors will come up at Hyderabad’s Nanakramguda Junction to IT Heights Road, Biodiversity to Leather Institute and IT Heights Road to Khajaguda Junction and it will be developed with ₹16.7 crore.

26.title: Cong leader injured after being 'pushed' by police during Bharat Jodo Yatra, pic surfaces
26.article_body: Congress leader Nitin Raut sustained injuries after he was allegedly pushed by police personnel during Bharat Jodo Yatra in Telangana. Raut has been admitted to Hyderabad's Vasavi Hospital. He sustained injuries in his right eye, hands and legs. "I was moving towards stage when Rahul Gandhi's convoy came, police panicked and pushed me. I fell near a barricade," he stated.

27.title: Tesla shuts down its first store in China amid retail strategy shift: Report
27.article_body: Tesla has reportedly shut down its first showroom in China as the electric vehicle giant is adjusting its sales and service strategy in its second-largest market. Tesla's showroom in Beijing's Parkview Green was shut down and now the showroom's windows are plastered with posters belonging to the next tenant. Notably, the store opened in 2013 and was renovated in 2018.

28.title: Farah says SRK made her filmmaker, posts pic from his b'day celebration
28.article_body: Farah Khan on Wednesday shared a picture from Shah Rukh Khan's birthday celebration, which took place at his house, Mannat. The celebration was also joined by Shah Rukh's manager Pooja Dadlani. Earlier, Farah shared a video on Instagram and called him the man who made her a filmmaker. "The world is lucky to have you," she wrote on Instagram Stories.

29.title: Elon Musk asks over 50 employees from his other firms to work at Twitter: Reports
29.article_body: Elon Musk has authorised over 50 employees from his other companies to work at Twitter, according to reports. These include 50 employees from Tesla, two from The Boring Company and one from Neuralink, reports said. The employees reportedly include Tesla's Director - Autopilot Software Ashok Elluswamy and Director of Engineering - Autopilot & Tesla Bot Milan Kovac.

30.title: Virat Kohli breaks record for smashing most runs in T20 World Cup history
30.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli on Wednesday broke the record for smashing most runs in T20 World Cup history. During his innings against Bangladesh in their T20 World Cup 2022 match, Kohli overtook former Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena's record tally of 1,016 runs in T20 World Cups. Kohli crossed Jayawardena's mark in just 23 innings.

31.title: Pressure to deliver was immense: Siddharth Anand on 'Pathaan' teaser
31.article_body: Director Siddharth Anand shared that because the team had decided to release the teaser of 'Pathaan' on Shah Rukh Khan's birthday, "the pressure to deliver was immense". "It had to be spectacular and memorable at the same time," Anand said, adding that the team is aiming to make 'Pathaan' "the biggest action spectacle". The film also stars Deepika Padukone.

32.title: India's Suryakumar Yadav becomes world number one T20I batter
32.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav has become the world number one T20I batter, as per the latest ICC rankings. The 32-year-old has now accumulated 863 rating points. He overtook Pakistan wicketkeeper-opener Muhammad Rizwan, who is now ranked second with 842 rating points. Virat Kohli (tenth) is the only other Indian in the top 10.

33.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹2.75 lakh by man claiming to be pilot from France
33.article_body: A 36-year-old Mumbai woman was cheated of ₹2.75 lakh by a man claiming to be a pilot from France on matrimonial app. The fraudster told the victim that he was coming to India to meet her but got detained at Delhi airport and needed ₹2.75 lakh to get bail. The victim got suspicious after being asked for ₹6.5 lakh more.

34.title: Woman gets stuck in elevator that collapsed in Mumbai, dies
34.article_body: A 62-year-old woman died after getting stuck in an elevator that collapsed in a residential building in Mumbai's Charkop, police said on Wednesday. The incident occurred in the multi-storey building when the woman was going down from the fourth floor for a morning walk. When a security guard tried to help, the elevator collapsed on the ground floor, police added.

35.title: I’d rather look at you than anything else: Dia as she shares pic from 2000 on SRK's b'day
35.article_body: Actress Dia Mirza took to Twitter to share a photo from 2000, featuring Shah Rukh Khan, Lara Dutta and Priyanka Chopra. While wishing Shah Rukh Khan on his birthday, Dia wrote, "I’d rather look at you than anything else- then, now and forever! Thank you for bringing so much joy to our lives. Thank you for being you."

36.title: Indonesian man known as 'Playboy King' to marry ex-wife in his 88th wedding
36.article_body: A 61-year-old Indonesian man is set to marry for the 88th time. The man known as "Playboy King" will be marrying his ex-wife. "Although it has been a long time since we separated, the love between us is still strong," he said, adding that he married for the first time when he was 14 years old.

37.title: Karnataka Bank's stock hits 52-week high after quarterly results
37.article_body: A day after Karnataka Bank posted an all-time high net profit of ₹411 crore for the September quarter, its stock opened 17% higher on Wednesday to hit a 52-week high. Its net profit surged by 228% year-on-year and its net interest income increased by 26%. At 12:30 pm, its stock was trading 19.99% higher at ₹112.55/share on BSE.

38.title: Delhi to give ₹5,000 per month to workers during ban on construction activities
38.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that he has directed Labour Minister Manish Sisodia to give ₹5,000 per month as financial support to workers till the time construction activities are banned. Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Sunday announced that the Delhi government has decided to implement the Commission for Air Quality Management's order, imposing a ban on construction and demolition activities.

39.title: India announce their playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh
39.article_body: Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Adelaide. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Axar Patel replacing Deepak Hooda. India are currently placed second on Group 2 points table, while Bangladesh are third.

40.title: Arshdeep's the 1st Indian bowler after Zaheer with unpredictable pace: Ajmal
40.article_body: Talking about Arshdeep Singh, ex-Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal said, "He gets two balls to move away and then gets one to jag back in. That...ball...is very difficult to face. Wasim Akram...[would] do the...same thing." "After Zaheer Khan, Arshdeep's the first Indian bowler whose swing and pace are unpredictable," added Ajmal. "You can't figure out what Arshdeep...[will] bowl," he stated.

41.title: Played Feroz Khan's elder sister when he was 20 yrs older than me: Neena
41.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said that she had once played late actor Feroz Khan's elder sister in a film. "He was 20 years older than me," she recalled, adding that she had played many such parts as these were the only roles she'd get in films. Neena will be seen in Sooraj Barjatya's upcoming film 'Uunchai', which also stars Amitabh Bachchan.

42.title: German firm Volocopter raises $182 mn in 2nd signing of Series E round
42.article_body: Volocopter, a German startup that builds electric vertical takeoff and landing vehicles, has secured $182 million for the second signing of its Series E round. The total size of Volocopter's latest round reached over $350 million, the largest deeptech round in Germany this year. The funds came from Saudi Arabia's smart city project NEOM and Hong Kong mobility fund GLy.

43.title: Cylinder blast at Mumbai's Dadar school; 3 injured, 2 cars damaged
43.article_body: At least three people were injured after a fire broke out on the terrace of Chhabildas English Medium School in Dadar, Mumbai due to an LPG gas cylinder explosion. The roof of the school building reportedly collapsed due to the explosion. Two cars also got damaged in the incident, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said.

44.title: Netherlands record their 1st win in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage, defeat Zimbabwe
44.article_body: Netherlands defeated Zimbabwe by five wickets in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage Group 2 match on Wednesday. It is Netherlands' first victory in the Super 12 stage of the ongoing tournament. Further, it is Netherlands' second victory in the second round in the history of T20 World Cup. Paul van Meekeren took three wickets for Netherlands today.

45.title: Cong's Bharat Jodo Yatra is bringing about silent revolution: Kharge
45.article_body: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday said that the party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra is bringing about a silent revolution that will change the political landscape. "Interacted with the Bharat yatris at Bowenpally in Hyderabad. They too are walking 3,500 kms with ⁦Rahul Gandhi⁩ Ji and are a source of great inspiration to our party cadres," Kharge tweeted.

46.title: Miss Grand Argentina and Miss Grand Puerto Rico 2020 get married; post video
46.article_body: Miss Grand International Argentina 2020 Mariana Varela and Miss Grand International Puerto Rico 2020 Fabiola Valentín announced their marriage on social media by sharing a video. "After deciding to keep our relationship private, we opened the doors to it on a special day, 28/10/22," the caption read. "Congratulations to both of you," Miss Grand International's Instagram profile said.

47.title: Suhana shares throwback pic with Shah Rukh on his b'day, calls him her 'bestest friend'
47.article_body: On the occasion of Shah Rukh Khan's 57th birthday, his daughter Suhana shared an old photo featuring the two of them and Aryan on her Instagram. Sharing the photo, she wrote, "Happy birthday to my bestest friend. I love you the most." In a rare gesture, Shah Rukh greeted fans waiting outside his residence at midnight on his birthday.

48.title: Messi confuses players by seeming less interested, then changing pace: Henry
48.article_body: Former Barcelona footballer Thierry Henry said most defenders get "confused" by the manner in which Lionel Messi always seems "less interested" when the game starts, going on to change his pace later. "Messi is in frightening form [this season]," added Henry. Messi has scored 12 goals and registered 13 assists having played 17 matches so far for PSG this season.

49.title: Fresh produce startup Otipy appoints Rohit Sood as Chief Business Officer
49.article_body: Otipy, a fresh produce startup, appointed Rohit Sood as its Chief Business Officer. Sood has over 16 years of experience and has been associated with companies such as SPAR, Carrefour, Snapdeal, Paytm Mall and JioMart. Earlier this year, Otipy, backed by WestBridge Capital, Omidyar Network, SIG and others, had raised $32 million in a series B funding round.

50.title: US-based AI lending firm Upstart lays off 140 employees: Report
50.article_body: US-based AI lending platform Upstart has laid off 140 employees, TechCrunch reported. "We are making this difficult decision for the long-term health of the company," an Upstart spokesperson said, adding that no further layoffs are expected. In the latest filing, the company said that the decision was taken due to "reduction in the volume of loans" on its platform.

51.title: 2 lawyers' bodies refuse to represent 9 accused in Morbi bridge collapse case
51.article_body: Two lawyers' bodies in Gujarat have decided not to represent the nine accused arrested over the Morbi bridge collapse that killed at least 135 people. The resolution was passed by the Morbi Bar Association and Rajkot Bar Association on Wednesday. Among those arrested are managers of Oreva, the company that renovated the bridge, bridge repair contractors and three security guards.

52.title: Driver attached to Kerala minister's office arrested in molestation case
52.article_body: Kerala Police arrested a driver attached to the office of an LDF minister in connection with the cases of molesting a woman doctor in Thiruvananthapuram and of trespassing into a house. The accused is the driver of the personal secretary of Irrigation Minister Roshy Augustine. The department has been directed to immediately remove the driver from office, Augustine said.

53.title: Özil will never play for another English club, he's not Aubameyang: Agent
53.article_body: Former Arsenal footballer Mesut Özil's agent Dr Erkut Sogut said Özil will never play for another English club as he is not like ex-Arsenal footballer Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, who currently represents Chelsea. "Özil loved his time at Arsenal," added Sogut. "If there was a discussion to go to another Premier League club...it would have never, ever happened," Sogut had earlier stated.

54.title: SaaS firm Freshworks' Q3 revenue rises by 37% y-o-y to $128.8 mn
54.article_body: Software-as-a-service (SaaS) firm Freshworks posted a 37% rise in consolidated revenue at $128.8 million year-on-year for the third quarter ended September. This was led by improved operating efficiency and customer additions. The firm's operational loss was recorded at $58.3 million during the quarter as against $67.4 million in the previous quarter. Its quarter-on-quarter revenue was around 5%.

55.title: Temasek will not exit company as of now: Medanta-owner Global Health
55.article_body: The management of Global Health Limited, which operates and manages Medanta hospitals, said Temasek will not exit the company as of now. Temasek currently holds a 19% stake in Global Health. Global Health's IPO will open for subscription on Thursday and the price band has been fixed at ₹319-₹336 per share. Carlyle is another shareholder, which holds around 20% stake.

56.title: What is India's record against Bangladesh in T20I cricket?
56.article_body: India and Bangladesh have played 11 T20Is against each other, with India winning 10 times and losing once. India have won four of their last five T20I matches against Bangladesh. India's highest T20I total against Bangladesh is 180/5, which they registered in June 2009. Rohit Sharma has scored 452 runs in T20Is against Bangladesh, most by a Team India batter.

57.title: Some Twitter staff told to work 12-hr shifts, 7 days in office after Musk takeover: Reports
57.article_body: Managers at Twitter have reportedly instructed some employees to work 12-hour shifts, seven days a week, to meet deadlines after Elon Musk’s takeover. As per another report, some managers even slept at the office on the weekend. Twitter employees who were there before Musk’s acquisition, have reportedly been asked to justify their work and their teams' work.

58.title: Invested in Twitter in support of freedom of speech: Binance CEO
58.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao has said he is "extremely supportive" of freedom of speech, which is the main reason behind his company's $500 million investment into Elon Musk's Twitter buyout. Zhao called Twitter "an important free speech platform". Last week, Binance said it is creating a team to work on how blockchain and crypto could be helpful to Twitter.

59.title: Officer saves child who fell from mother's arms at Mumbai station
59.article_body: A Railways officer saved a child from slipping under the train tracks at Mumbai's Mankhurd Railway Station. The child fell from the mother's arm while she was trying to board a local train and lost her balance. In the video, shared by Railway Protection Force (RPF), the officer is seen dragging the child away from the edge of the station.

60.title: India reports 1,190 COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 16,243
60.article_body: India reported 1,190 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,046 fresh COVID-19 cases. The active cases went down to 16,243 from the earlier 17,618. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,30,452, according to the ministry.

61.title: Man accused of attacking Pelosi's husband was on 'suicide mission': Report
61.article_body: David DePape, accused of breaking into US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's house and beating her husband, has told police that he was on a "suicide mission", court filing showed. DePape had plans to target other California and federal politicians. The filing mentioned that Paul Pelosi was knocked unconscious by a hammer and he woke up in a pool of blood.

62.title: My kids and I are safe now: Rambha after her car accident in Canada
62.article_body: Actress Rambha, who recently met with an accident in Canada, informed her fans that she and her kids are safe. "My daughter Sasha is also safe. We all came back to our house," she shared. The actress thanked her fans, friends, and family members for their prayers and expressed how she felt "overwhelmed" by their support.

63.title: I will not fight anymore to be no. 1 like I did in the past: Nadal
63.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he will "not fight" anymore to become the world number one like he did in the past. "I achieved that goal a couple of times...[in] my career...[and] I have been very, very happy and proud about achieving that," added Nadal. "I just fight to keep being competitive in every event that I play," stated Nadal.

64.title: SRK would spread a cloth & sleep on floor if vanity van wasn't ready, recalls Aditya
64.article_body: On the occasion of Shah Rukh Khan's birthday, Aditya Narayan recalled shooting with him for 'Pardes'. He said, "I remember he was shooting for another film, he used to come to sets, vanity van wouldn’t be ready. He would...pick a corner in the room, put his bag, spread a cloth on the floor, and sleep….No complaints and no ego."

65.title: Singer Davido's 3-year-old son dies after drowning in swimming pool at home in Nigeria
65.article_body: Afrobeats star Davido's son Ifeanyi Adeleke, who turned three last month, passed away after drowning in the swimming pool at his home in Nigeria's Lagos. The Nigerian police have summoned eight domestic workers for questioning. "We are reviewing the CCTV cameras to get additional information about the circumstances of his death," an official said.

66.title: I feel sick, I threw up: Dokic on video of man assaulting daughter during tennis practice
66.article_body: Ex-women's world number four tennis player Jelena Dokic has reacted to a viral video of a man in Serbia slapping and kicking his 14-year-old daughter during tennis practice. "I feel sick...I threw up and I'm heartbroken," the Australian wrote. "Just another day for us and that includes this...girl. Imagine what happens behind closed doors. It's even worse," she added.

67.title: Liverpool, Spurs enter CL round of 16; Bayern maintain unbeaten run
67.article_body: Liverpool and Tottenham Hotspur entered the round of 16 stage of the ongoing edition of the Champions League, following a 2-0 win against Napoli and 2-1 triumph against Marseille respectively. Liverpool had earlier suffered a 1-4 defeat against Napoli. Bayern Munich maintained their unbeaten run in the ongoing season, recording a 2-0 win against Inter Milan.

68.title: China locks down area around world's largest iPhone factory over COVID outbreak
68.article_body: China has locked down area around the world's largest iPhone factory in Zhengzhou over a COVID-19 outbreak. The lockdown will last until November 9, the local government said in a statement posted on its WeChat account. No vehicles are allowed to operate except for those carrying necessities, the government further said.

69.title: Actress Pooja Bhatt joins Rahul for Cong’s Bharat Jodo Yatra in Hyd
69.article_body: Actress Pooja Bhatt on Wednesday briefly joined Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra in Hyderabad and walked with party leader Rahul Gandhi. "Every day a new history is being created...Every day the number of people who love is increasing in the country," the party wrote while tweeting photos of Bhatt joining the yatra. The yatra resumed from Hyderabad today morning.

70.title: Hansika Motwani to marry businessman Sohael Khaturiya, shares proposal pics
70.article_body: Actress Hansika Motwani took to Instagram on Wednesday to share photos with Mumbai-based entrepreneur Sohael Khaturiya from their proposal in Paris. Sharing the photos, she wrote, "Now & Forever." As per reports, she will marry her friend and business partner Sohael in the first week of December. The wedding will reportedly take place at Mundota Fort and Palace in Jaipur.

71.title: Heroin worth ₹5 crore, hidden inside 52 soap cases, seized in Assam
71.article_body: Assam's Karimganj Police on Monday seized 676 grams of heroin worth around ₹5 crore. "Police intercepted a vehicle coming from a neighbouring state...seized heroin packed in 52 soap cases, which were carefully packed inside baby wet wipes and stacked inside the sound box of the vehicle," CM Himanta Biswa Sarma tweeted. Sarma also shared a video of the incident.

72.title: Govt should tell who is responsible for deaths: Owaisi on Morbi bridge collapse
72.article_body: Reacting to the Morbi bridge collapse incident, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that this is a "painful accident" and we hope that PM Narendra Modi and the Gujarat government will give justice to the families of those who lost their lives. "Government should tell who is responsible for the deaths of so many people," he added.

73.title: S Korean PM urges police to explain response to emergency calls before stampede
73.article_body: South Korean Prime Minister Han Duck-soo has said that police must explain how they responded to multiple emergency calls before more than 150 people were killed in a stampede in Seoul. "The police must conduct thorough inspections and provide a clear and transparent explanation," Han said. Emergency calls' transcripts showed first warning came four hours before the stampede.

74.title: South Korea fires 3 missiles after North Korea launches over 10 missiles
74.article_body: South Korea's military said on Wednesday it had fired three precision air-to-ground missiles near the spot on the maritime border where a North Korean missile landed earlier in the day. North Korea had fired more than 10 missiles. South Korean military called the firing of missiles by North Korea "very rare and intolerable".

75.title: LIC Housing Finance stock falls by 10% after September quarter results
75.article_body: Shares of LIC Housing Finance hit the 10% lower circuit on Wednesday after posting a 23% year-on-year growth in net profit at ₹305 crore in the September quarter. Its net interest income for the quarter fell by 80 basis points to ₹1,163 crore from ₹1,173 crore. At 10: 25 am, its stock was trading 9.58% lower at ₹362.05/piece on BSE.

76.title: Mutual love & affection between minor couple not sexual assault under POCSO: HC
76.article_body: The Meghalaya High Court held that acts of mutual love and affection between a young couple will not amount to "sexual assault" under the POCSO act. The court made this observation while quashing POCSO charges against a minor’s partner. The accused was booked after the minor girl’s mother alleged that he had sexually assaulted her daughter.

77.title: Shah Rukh said audience clapped on my entry in 'DDLJ': Himani Shivpuri
77.article_body: Himani Shivpuri recalled that Shah Rukh Khan had asked her to watch 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' in theatres to experience audiences' response to her entry scene. "'Crowds clap when you make your entry,' he told me," Shivpuri said. She stated that during the iconic saree scene, even though Shah Rukh had a different shot, he stood and gave his reactions.

78.title: Don't think it'll happen: Hathaway on 'The Devil Wears Prada' sequel
78.article_body: Actress Anne Hathaway said that she doesn't know if there can be a sequel to 'The Devil Wears Prada'. Even though the idea of a sequel "is tempting" for Anne, she stated that the film was made "in a different era" and now, everything is "very different". "They could relaunch it, get some new people and do it," she added.

79.title: PM gives orders to Telangana CM KCR on phone, says Rahul Gandhi
79.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while addressing a gathering in Telangana, on Tuesday said Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao gets orders from PM Narendra Modi on phone. "Whenever there's any bill in Parliament, TRS supports BJP and diverts attention from Opposition's issues," Gandhi added. "Your CM does drama before polls but he's in direct line with PM Modi," he stated.

80.title: Punjab starts entrepreneur scheme in 31 govt schools as pilot project
80.article_body: Punjab Minister of School Education Harjot Singh Bains on Tuesday launched the "Business Blasters Young Entrepreneur Scheme" as a pilot project in 31 government schools across Punjab. "We aim to launch it in all senior secondary schools next year," he tweeted. Under the scheme, the students of Class 11 will be provided seed money of ₹2,000 to start a business.

81.title: Laptop lifting gang busted, 41 cases solved: Pune Police
81.article_body: The Pune City Police busted a laptop lifting gang operating in the city and solved 41 cases and recovered 16 laptops and a motorcycle worth ₹8.35 lakh from the accused. The accused used to target parked cars and by breaking windows they used to steal laptops, the police said. The stolen laptops were sold in Delhi and Haryana markets.

82.title: Fusion Microfinance ₹1,104-cr IPO opens today, issue to end on Friday
82.article_body: The initial public offering (IPO) of Fusion Microfinance is set to open for public subscription on Wednesday and will end on Friday. The company has fixed a price band of ₹350-₹368/share for its ₹1,104-crore IPO. The IPO comprises a fresh issue of ₹600 crore worth of equity shares and an offer for sale (OFS) of 1.36 crore equity shares.

83.title: UPL Founder Rajju Shroff steps down as CMD, Jai Shroff named Chairman
83.article_body: Global crop protection products manufacturer UPL announced that its Founder Rajju Shroff has stepped down as Chairman and Managing Director (CMD). Shroff, 90, will become Chairman Emeritus of the Board, effective from December 1, 2022, the company said in its filing. Jai Shroff, a Non-executive Director has been designated as the Chairman of the Board with effect from December 1.

84.title: Kohli gave importance to fielding, Rohit's not bothered: Ajay Jadeja
84.article_body: Discussing India's fielding in a T20 World Cup 2022 match against South Africa, Ajay Jadeja said, "Team India...isn't much athletic...Rohit Sharma isn't bothered about fielding." "[The] last time I heard about...importance [being given] to fielding was when Virat Kohli became the captain," added Ajay. Ajay stated that one cannot expect "good" fielding from Ravichandran Ashwin and Mohammad Shami.

85.title: Can resign within week if CM permits & face bypoll: Maha minister to Aaditya
85.article_body: Maharashtra minister Abdul Sattar challenged state minister Aaditya Thackeray to face an election by resigning from his constituency. Sattar said he's ready to tender his resignation within a week if CM Eknath Shinde allows him and face a byelection from Sillod constituency. "Even if he (Aaditya) doesn’t tender his resignation…I can resign within one week and face election," Sattar stated.

86.title: Have never participated in or produced anything pornographic in my life: Raj Kundra
86.article_body: During an #AskRaj session, Raj Kundra responded to a Twitter user about his arrest in connection with the alleged creation and uploading of porn films on apps. He wrote, "I can assure my well-wishers (that) I have never participated in or produced anything pornographic in my life." Kundra was arrested in July 2021 and was granted bail two months later.

87.title: Which are the highest match aggregates in T20 history as world record gets broken?
87.article_body: The Titans-Knights CSA T20 Challenge match witnessed combined 501 runs, breaking the world record for the highest match aggregate in T20 cricket history. The previous highest aggregate (497 runs) was recorded in Central Districts-Otago match in 2016. A Trinbago Knight Riders-Jamaica Tallawahs match in 2019 witnessed 493 runs, the third-highest match aggregate.

88.title: Indian-origin former employee admits cheating Apple of ₹140 crore
88.article_body: Dhirendra Prasad, a former Apple employee, has pleaded guilty to fraud that led to a loss of more than $17 million (₹140 crore) to the company, according to a statement from the California Department of Justice. Indian-origin Prasad said he began to defraud Apple back in 2011 by inflating invoices, stealing parts and charging Apple for services it never received.

89.title: Delhi's air quality 'very poor' with 354 AQI; Noida's 'severe' with 406
89.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Wednesday morning was recorded as 'very poor' with an air quality index (AQI) of 354. The AQI in Uttar Pradesh's Noida stood at 406 in the 'severe' category, while in Gurugram it stood at 346 in the 'very poor' category. An AQI of 350 was recorded near the Terminal 3 of the Delhi airport.

90.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro authorises transition of power after losing in Prez polls
90.article_body: In his first public remarks after losing election, Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro did not concede defeat, but authorised his team to begin transition process. Bolsonaro's comment came 44 hours after electoral authorities announced the election result. Meanwhile, his supporters blocked highways and some called for a military coup to stop President-elect Lula da Silva from returning to power.

91.title: ED summons Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Thursday in illegal mining case
91.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Thursday in a money laundering probe linked to an alleged illegal mining case in the state. ED filed a charge-sheet in September 2022 under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) in connection with illegal mining and extortion in Jharkhand and Bihar. Earlier, ED arrested Soren's aide Pankaj Mishra.

92.title: You need to be very careful with words: Afridi on Gambhir criticising Babar
92.article_body: Reacting to Gautam Gambhir criticising Babar Azam, Shahid Afridi said, "We'll try to ask Babar to say something about Gambhir after the T20 World Cup 2022." "You need to be very careful with words," added Afridi. Discussing Babar Azam's captaincy during a T20 World Cup 2022 match, Gambhir had stated that Babar should think about his team instead of himself.

93.title: BMC cancels ₹5,800 crore tender issued to make Mumbai free of potholes
93.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) announced that it was scrapping the ₹5,800-crore tender that it had floated on August 2 for completing cement concretisation of 400 km of Mumbai's roads to make the city free of potholes. The tenders were cancelled due to low response from the bidders who blamed the stringent eligibility criteria laid by the civic body.

94.title: Shah Rukh Khan greets fans outside Mannat on his 57th birthday
94.article_body: Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan came to the balcony of Mannat, his Mumbai house, to greet fans who had gathered to celebrate his 57th birthday. The actor was joined by his youngest child, AbRam. In a video, Shah Rukh was seen doing his signature pose. He also took a selfie from his balcony and greeted his fans with folded hands.

95.title: Been told we don't fit the mould of conventional B'wood heroine: Huma
95.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi shared that she and Sonakshi Sinha were often told that they don't fit into the mould of a "conventional Hindi film heroine". She added her upcoming film 'Double XL' is for everyone who's "been told they are misfits". Sonakshi said the actresses were body shamed "even before we started our career" because of their body type.

96.title: Windfall tax on crude petroleum slashed; levy hiked on ATF, diesel
96.article_body: The Centre has cut the windfall tax on crude petroleum exports to ₹9,500/tonne from ₹11,000/tonne. The windfall tax on aviation turbine fuel (ATF) has been increased from ₹3.50/litre to ₹5/litre and it has been hiked from ₹12/litre to ₹13/litre on diesel. The duty on diesel exports includes the road and infrastructure cess (RIC) charge of ₹1.50 per litre.

97.title: Jobless youth falling prey to gold smuggling mafia: Hyd Customs officials
97.article_body: Jobless people are lured into carrying gold to Indian cities and offered small sums of money and air tickets in exchange, Hyderabad Customs officials said. For a trip, they are paid between ₹25,000 and ₹30,000 and if caught the amount is reduced to half, Hyderabad Police official said. The gold carriers are from economically backward families, the police official added.

98.title: Contractors who repaired Morbi bridge were 'not qualified' for such work, court told
98.article_body: The prosecution has told a court in Gujarat that the contractors who carried out repairs at the collapsed Morbi bridge, "weren't qualified" to carry out such work. The prosecution added that while the bridge's flooring was replaced, its cable was not replaced and it could not take the weight of the changed flooring. The mishap claimed at least 135 lives.

99.title: Karthik let go of 2 important opportunities presented to him: Bangar
99.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar said Dinesh Karthik "let go" of two important opportunities presented to him during India's T20 World Cup 2022 matches against Pakistan and South Africa. "Although he didn't have...much time...[against Pakistan], he should have done the job that Ravichandran Ashwin did. In the last match against South Africa, he had a lot of time," added Bangar.

100.title: Julie Powell, food writer behind 'Julie & Julia', passes away at 49 due to cardiac arrest
100.article_body: Food writer Julie Powell passed away aged 49 due to cardiac arrest. She was known for spending a year documenting her attempts to cook all recipes in Julia Child's 'Mastering the Art of French Cooking' for her blog. It was later turned into book 'Julie & Julia: 365 Days, 524 Recipes, 1 Tiny Apartment Kitchen', and movie 'Julie & Julia'.

101.title: 3 arrested, minor boy detained over eatery manager's murder in Pune
101.article_body: Police have arrested three persons and detained a minor boy for allegedly murdering a 24-year-old restaurant manager, who was found dead with 48 stab injuries, in Pune's Dhayari. "Investigation suggests that one accused and the victim had had a fight over their relationship with the same woman," police said. The murder was a fallout of their rivalry, police added.

102.title: More senior Twitter officials quit after Musk takeover & firing of top executives
102.article_body: After Elon Musk's takeover and the firing of some top executives, more senior officials quit the firm. Twitter's advertising chief Sarah Personette, Chief People and Diversity Officer Dalana Brand and General Manager for core technologies Nick Caldwell were among those who informed on social media about their departures. Chief Marketing Officer Leslie Berland has also reportedly left the company.

103.title: Airlines increase daily flight operation slots for Pune airport
103.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) approved over 200 slots daily for civil flight operations for Pune airport, the Airport Authority of India said. "Till now, 85 slots each for departure and arrival have been applied for with regard to daily flight operations but the number will only increase in coming months considering year-end and the vacation season," airport director said.

104.title: Please continue complaining, but Twitter blue tick will cost $8: Musk to 'complainers'
104.article_body: Responding to "complainers" after he confirmed that Twitter will charge $8 per month if anybody wants the blue tick, Elon Musk tweeted, "Please continue complaining, but it will cost $8." Reacting to his tweet, a user wrote, "How will this work, Mr Musk? Once verified you need to pay 8 dollars or anyone can pay 8 dollars and get verified?"

105.title: North Korea fires more than 10 missiles; people in S Korea told to 'hide in bunkers'
105.article_body: South Korea's military has said that North Korea fired a total of more than 10 missiles off its eastern and western coasts. One of the missiles landed close to South Korea's territorial waters. An air raid warning was issued for the South Korean island of Ulleungdo, which was flashed on national television and told residents to "hide in bunkers".

106.title: Largest whales consume 1 crore pieces of microplastic daily off California coast: Study
106.article_body: A study published in Nature Communications found that blue whales, the largest animals on the planet, off California's coast are consuming about 1 crore pieces of microplastic every day. A whale that feeds mostly on fish consumes about 2,00,000 pieces a day, the study found. Some microplastic consumed by the whales are even smaller than 5 millimetres, the study added.

107.title: Ghaziabad family receives part of stolen jewellery back days after theft
107.article_body: A family in Ghaziabad, whose jewellery and cash were stolen from their home on October 23, received part of the jewellery back a few days later. The theft took place when the family was out of town. "On October 29, we received a courier purportedly from a jeweller in Hapur...it contained some of the stolen jewellery," a family member said.

108.title: I'll beg on streets to find money for 'Dilli Ki Yogshala' scheme: CM
108.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has announced that 'Dilli Ki Yogshala' scheme will continue and he'll "beg on streets to provide money for classes" if he has to. Delhi government alleged that LG VK Saxena refused to approve the scheme. "[BJP and LG] may use all their political power and arrogance...but Delhi's two crore people won't let them succeed," he added.

109.title: Elon Musk announces $8 per month price for blue tick on Twitter
109.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk confirmed the microblogging website will charge $8 per month if anybody wants the 'blue tick', and tweeted, "Power to the people! Blue for $8/month." He added, "Price adjusted by country proportionate to purchasing power parity." Musk called Twitter's current policies for who has or doesn't have a blue checkmark "lords & peasants system" and "bulls**t".

110.title: Maha logs 257 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death; active cases at 1,566
110.article_body: Maharashtra recorded 257 fresh cases of COVID-19 along with one death due to the infection in the last 24 hours, the state health department informed on Tuesday. The lone fatality was reported from Mumbai, as per news agency PTI. With the fresh cases, the state's total case tally rose to 81,32,170. The state's active case count now stands at 1,566.

111.title: Want to show I deserve national call-up: Gill after scoring T20 century
111.article_body: After scoring a 126(55) in Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy on Tuesday, Indian batter Shubman Gill said that he wants to show that he deserves the call-up for the upcoming India-New Zealand T20I series. Gill's ton against Karnataka helped his side, Punjab, advance into the semi-final stages of the domestic tournament. "It's an important milestone for me," Gill said.

112.title: Former Gujarat BJP minister Chauhan joins Congress ahead of polls
112.article_body: Ex-BJP minister Prabhatsinh Chauhan joined the Congress in Fagvel, Gujarat on Tuesday ahead of the upcoming state Assembly elections. Chauhan was a BJP MP from Panchmahal from 2009-19 and also, a tribal development minister from 2004-07 in the BJP-run Gujarat state government. "BJP has failed in Gujarat. The party is not going to win future elections," the 81-year-old politician said.

113.title: Will not issue decree to formally end mobilisation: Russia
113.article_body: Russia on Tuesday said a presidential decree will not be issued to formally declare the end of the partial mobilisation of reservists in the country. Russian President Vladimir Putin declared the mobilisation on September 21 amidst the war with Ukraine. Earlier, Russia said it had recruited 3,00,000 reservists and that no more would be needed.

114.title: Singapore PM extends condolences over Morbi bridge tragedy
114.article_body: Singapore PM Lee Hsien Loong on Tuesday extended his condolences to the families of the victims of the Morbi cable bridge collapse, which has claimed the lives of 135 people so far. "Our thoughts are with the people of India during this time, and I wish the injured a speedy recovery," Lee said in a letter to PM Narendra Modi.

115.title: At this moment in my career I don’t fight to be no. 1: Nadal after son's birth
115.article_body: World number two Rafael Nadal, who has come to Paris for his first tournament after the birth of his son, said, "I'm in a moment of my tennis career that I don't fight to be number one." The 36-year-old has achieved the year-end number one ranking five times. Nadal has 5,820 points, trailing top-ranked Carlos Alcaraz, who has 6,650 points.

116.title: Aircraft-shaped balloon with BHN, Emirates printed on it found in J&K
116.article_body: An aircraft-shaped balloon with 'BHN' and 'Emirates' printed on it was recovered by police along the international border in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba on Tuesday. The green and white coloured balloon had crescent moon and star of the Pakistani flag printed on it. A similar balloon with 'Pakistan International Airlines' printed on it was found in Rajasthan earlier on Tuesday.

117.title: Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif begins two-day visit to China
117.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif began his two-day official visit to China on Tuesday, as he is set to become the first head of government to felicitate Chinese President Xi Jinping for securing an unprecedented third term in office. Sharif is expected to hold delegation-level talks with Chinese Premier Li Keqiang. Finance Minister Ishaq Dar is part of Sharif's delegation.

118.title: Bain Capital sells 0.54% stake in Axis Bank for ₹1,487 crore
118.article_body: US-based private investment company Bain Capital on Tuesday sold 0.54% stake in Axis Bank. According to BSE data, 16.7 million shares were sold at ₹891.38 each, higher than the floor price of ₹888 set by the firm, taking the transaction size to ₹1,486.82 crore. As of September 2022, three Bain Capital affiliates held 4.24% stake in the lender.

119.title: India saw extreme weather event on 90% of days in 2022's first 9 months: Report
119.article_body: A Centre for Science and Environment report has claimed that India recorded an extreme weather event on almost 90% of the days in first nine months of 2022. The report added that these disasters claimed 2,775 lives, with Himachal Pradesh recording the highest number of human deaths, and affected 1.8 million hectares of crop area. Disasters destroyed 4.16 lakh houses.

120.title: Indian firms to take part in international trade fair in Havana: Cuba
120.article_body: Cuban Ambassador to India Alejandro Simancas Marin on Tuesday said more than 35 Indian companies are expected to participate in an international trade fair slated to be held in Havana. "An 'India Day' will also be held," Marin added. The ambassador said Cuba has a "very good" relationship with India based on values of cooperation, dialogue and friendship.

121.title: Israeli national elections held for 5th time since 2019
121.article_body: The Israeli national elections were held for the fifth time since 2019 on Tuesday. A political deadlock has affected the country for the last three and a half years. The main candidates in the fray are former premier Benjamin Netanyahu, who is facing corruption charges, and centrist caretaker Prime Minister Yair Lapid.

122.title: Dad has been there on every step: Venus on 28th anniversary of her WTA debut
122.article_body: Seven-time singles Grand Slam champion Venus Williams took to Instagram Stories to share a picture on the 28th anniversary of her debut on WTA tour and wrote, "Dad [Richard] has been there every step of the way." "It's been a journey," she wrote while sharing another picture. The 42-year-old defeated Shaun Stafford 6-3, 6-4 in California on October 31, 1994.

123.title: Evidence of ancient ocean found on Mars: Study
123.article_body: Using topography maps and by analysing the layers of sediment deposited over time on Mars, researchers have found evidence of nearly a 3.5-billion-year-old shoreline. The shoreline, which was characterised by around 900 m thick sedimentary pileup, spans several thousand square kilometres, proving the existence of a massive ocean. Its water carried sediments leaving lasting marks on Mars' surface.

124.title: MDs of 5 UP discoms admit to overcharging ₹4.1 crore from consumers
124.article_body: Appearing before the UP Electricity Regulatory Commission, five distribution companies' MDs, all IAS officers, admitted that they overcharged ₹4.1 crore from consumers. They claimed that they're now refunding the overcharged amount to consumers. The Commission has asked the MDs to furnish affidavits stating the extra amount realised and refunded. All MDs will have to appear again on December 6.

125.title: Deforestation caused recent mudslide: Philippine President Marcos
125.article_body: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr on Tuesday blamed deforestation for a recent mudslide in the country which buried a mountainside community. "I noticed that in all places where the landslides came down, the mountains were bald," Marcos Jr said after an aerial inspection of the area. The landslides were triggered by Tropical Storm Nalgae.

126.title: Pant is a big batter, you're tossing him up and down like a coin: Madan Lal
126.article_body: Madan Lal said a "match-winner" like Rishabh Pant should be included in India's playing XI in T20 World Cup 2022 irrespective of Dinesh Karthik playing or not. "He's such a big batter...you're just tossing him up and down like a coin. He's bound to lose his confidence," he added. Pant hasn't been picked in India's playing XI so far.

127.title: Bilaspur jail inmate threatened to kill U'khand HC judge: Official
127.article_body: A threatening letter sent to the office of Registrar General of Uttarakhand High Court has been traced to an inmate of the Bilaspur Central Jail in Chhattisgarh, an official said on Tuesday. In the letter, which was sent a week ago, the accused demanded money. The accused threatened to murder the judge if the money wasn't sent, the official said.

128.title: Police officer breastfeeds infant separated from mother in Kerala
128.article_body: MR Ramya, a female police officer in Kerala who breastfed a 12-day-old baby separated from its mother due to a fight between its parents, has been praised by State Police Chief (SPC) and Kerala High Court's Justice Devan Ramachandran. "You are...the face of policing at its best," Justice Ramachandran said. She was also presented with a commendation certificate by SPC.

129.title: Uttar Pradesh Police gets new insignia, pic released
129.article_body: Director General of Police DS Chouhan today unveiled new insignia of Uttar Pradesh Police at its headquarters in Lucknow. From now on, police personnel of all ranks will wear it on their uniform, UP Police said in a statement. The insignia, navy blue and red in colour, will be worn atop the nameplate on the right side of the uniform.

130.title: BRS tapping our phones, paying voters ahead of Munugode bypoll: BJP
130.article_body: The BJP has complained to the Election Commission that the Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) is resorting to illegal means, including phone tapping, ahead of the Munugode bypoll in Telangana. The BJP demanded a thorough inquiry stating the methods are meant to stifle the voice of democracy. They also alleged that the BRS was transferring money to voters through mobile applications.

131.title: Congress will give India new govt under Rahul Gandhi in 2024: Kharge
131.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge said the Congress party will give a non-BJP government to the country under the leadership of Rahul Gandhi. "In the coming 2024 elections, the Congress government will come to power at the Centre," he said. Kharge also accused PM Narendra Modi of "spreading lies" every day that could ''destroy the country'' in the long term.

132.title: Rahul Gandhi hoists national flag at Charminar in Hyderabad
132.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday hoisted the national flag at Charminar in Hyderabad. The MP also paid tribute to his father Rajiv Gandhi. The annual event was organised in commemoration of Rajiv Gandhi's visit to Charminar on October 19, 1990 to launch Sadbhavana Yatra. The ex-PM had launched the yatra for communal peace and harmony in Hyderabad and Secunderabad.

133.title: 6 injured after explosion at steel rod factory in Maharashtra
133.article_body: At least six workers were injured, including three in critical condition, after a boiler exploded at a steel rod manufacturing plant in Maharashtra's Jalna district on Tuesday, police said. The incident occurred at the Geetai Steel Company in the Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation. Police said after the boiler exploded, hot molten iron fell on the workers.

134.title: Vivek Joshi takes charge as Financial Services Secretary
134.article_body: Senior bureaucrat Vivek Joshi on Tuesday took charge as the Secretary of the Department of Financial Services under the Ministry of Finance. Joshi assumed the role after Sanjay Malhotra was named as Revenue Secretary. Joshi, a 1989 batch IAS officer of the Haryana cadre, previously served as the Registrar General and Census Commissioner under the Ministry of Home Affairs.

135.title: What is the latest semi-final qualification scenario for T20 World Cup Super 12 Group 1?
135.article_body: Five teams in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 1 are in contention for two semi-final spots. If New Zealand, England and Australia win their final matches, it'll come down to NRR as the three teams will have seven points each. Australia would've to beat Afghanistan with big margin to advance as their NRR is worst among top three.

136.title: Guj polls delayed as PM has to inaugurate bridges like Morbi: Kharge
136.article_body: Newly elected Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge said that the Gujarat elections were delayed as PM Narendra Modi has to inaugurate more bridges like the one that fell in Morbi. Over 130 people, including women and children, were killed after a cable bridge collapsed in Morbi. After the tragedy, the assembly elections to be held in the state may be delayed.

137.title: 3 terrorists held; 10 kg bucket IED, 2 hand grenades seized in Srinagar
137.article_body: The Srinagar Police on Tuesday arrested three hybrid terrorists and seized a 10 kg improvised explosive device (IED) and two hand grenades from them. "The IED is being destroyed in situ in Rangreth area by...bomb disposal squad," Srinagar Police tweeted. A case has been registered under relevant sections of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, the Arms Act, and Explosives Act.

138.title: MoS Defence Ajay Bhatt visits Maharashtra NCC Directorate
138.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for Defence Ajay Bhatt visited the Maharashtra National Cadet Corps (NCC) Directorate on Tuesday, PRO (Defence) Mumbai informed. Bhatt interacted with NCC cadets there and lauded their contribution to various patriotic and social activities, the spokesperson said. The union minister exhorted the cadets to "inculcate discipline in day-to-day life", the spokesperson added.

139.title: Policy towards China must change: German Foreign Minister
139.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Tuesday said her government must form a new policy towards China. "The Chinese political system has changed massively in recent years and thus our China policy must also change," said Baerbock. The comments follow a recent political disagreement in Germany over a Chinese company acquiring a stake in the Port of Hamburg.

140.title: Kundra replies to tweet asking if marriage to Shilpa is 'staged', says 'Love is no act'
140.article_body: Raj Kundra, while answering some questions on Twitter, replied to a person who asked, "Are you & Shilpa [Shetty] still together or it's a staged act??" "Haha love this question. Love is no act and cannot be staged. 13th year anniversary on 22nd November don't forget to wish us," he responded. Kundra was arrested in a pornography-related case in 2021.

141.title: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar watches Kantara at Bengaluru ashram, Rishab shares video
141.article_body: Rishab Shetty's Kannada film 'Kantara' was recently screened for spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar at the ashram of Art of Living in Bengaluru. In a video shared by Rishab, Sri Sri Ravi Shankar was seen praising the film. He said, "[Its] success brings...pride to Karnataka. The acting and storytelling were very enjoyable...It shows Malenadu's greatness in a beautiful way."

142.title: It'll change course of Pak film industry: Nadeem on 'The Legend...' success
142.article_body: Producer Nadeem Mandviwalla, speaking about the success of 'The Legend of Maula Jatt', said that it will change the course of the Pakistani film industry. "One film changes the course of...industry and this will happen with Maula Jatt," he added. The film, which was released in Pakistan on October 13, stars Fawad Khan, Mahira Khan and Humaima Malick.

143.title: India will qualify for T20 WC semis, hopefully final as well: Ganguly
143.article_body: Former India captain Sourav Ganguly said India will comfortably qualify for the T20 World Cup 2022 semifinals. "India only lost one match. India will qualify. Everyone is doing good...I'm hopeful that India will play finals," said the ex-BCCI President. India are currently second in Group 2 having won two out of three matches and will face Bangladesh and Zimbabwe next.

144.title: Tribal development ministry formed under Vajpayee: PM Modi
144.article_body: Targeting the Congress, and saying that previous governments didn't think about all-round development of tribal areas in the country, PM Narendra Modi said that the tribal development ministry was formed under Atal Bihari Vajpayee. "No such ministry existed before the BJP came to power. Money was spent for tribal development work after the ministry was formed," PM Modi added.

145.title: Indian Railways' earning from freight rises 17% in April-October
145.article_body: Indian Railways registered freight loading of 855.63 million tonnes (MT) during April-October 2022, marking a 9% increase from the last year's record of 786.2 MT. Further, the Railways has earned ₹92,345 crore during the period, as compared to ₹78,921 crore earning made in the same period last year. This marks an improvement of 17% in Railways earning.

146.title: Abhishek shares Aishwarya's pic from her debut film 'Iruvar' on her b'day
146.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram on Tuesday to wish his actress-wife Aishwarya Rai Bachchan on her birthday. Sharing a black-and-white picture of Aishwarya from her debut film 'Iruvar', he wrote, "Happy Birthday, wifey! Love, light, peace and eternal success." Several celebrities, including Esha Deol, Bipasha Basu and Riteish Deshmukh, wished Aishwarya in the comments section.

147.title: Auditioned for Randeep's part in 'Once Upon a Time in Mumbaai': Jaideep
147.article_body: Actor Jaideep Ahlawat revealed that he auditioned for 'Once Upon a Time in Mumbaai'. He auditioned for the part that Randeep Hooda ended up playing. Jaideep added he also auditioned for a role in 'Ishqiya'. When asked how he handles rejection, he said that initially, he used to feel bad but then he realised nothing can be done about it.

148.title: Rahul's form is concerning but it's good Team India is backing him: Jaffer
148.article_body: Speaking about KL Rahul, who is yet to score in double digits in ongoing T20 World Cup, Wasim Jaffer stated the India opener's form is concerning but it's good that the team is backing him. "Rahul will feel happy that...think tank of the side has backed him," he added. Earlier, Rahul Dravid said he's hoping that Rahul performs well ahead.

149.title: Pub owners in Germany to boycott telecast of Qatar World Cup
149.article_body: Some pub owners in Germany said they will not be showing Qatar World Cup matches, taking an "ethical" stand given the Gulf state's record on human rights. "Others will watch anyway but ultimately, it's my bar and my decision," said a bar owner. Another owner said the decision was not a smart decision "from an economic point of view".

150.title: T'gana CM does drama before polls but takes orders from PM Modi: Rahul
150.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday claimed PM Narendra Modi gives orders to Telangana CM and TRS leader K Chandrashekar Rao on phone. He added, "[KCR] does drama before polls but he's in direct line with PM Modi." The MP further said, "TRS...supports the BJP whenever a bill is presented in the Parliament." He claimed the two parties "work together".

151.title: AAP B-team of BJP, it emerged from RSS-backed movement: Congress
151.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh called AAP "the B-team of BJP" and alleged that it emerged from an RSS-backed movement in 2012. "India Against Corruption was a front organisation of the RSS and the AAP emerged from that", Ramesh said. He added that in terms of workers and candidates, the fight in Gujarat polls is only between Congress and BJP.

152.title: Sex racket busted in guest house in Odisha; 12 people arrested
152.article_body: A sex racket, which was being run from a private guest house in Odisha's Ganjam district, was busted by the police and 12 people were arrested. The arrested persons include customers, agents, who used to lure customers through WhatsApp messages, and the kingpin, police said. Notably, three women were rescued and several items, including 12 mobile phones, were seized.

153.title: SEBI fines 21 entities ₹1.05 crore for manipulating share price
153.article_body: SEBI has issued a cumulative fine of ₹1.05 crore on 21 entities for manipulating the share price of Sunstar Realty Development Limited (SRDL). SEBI has fined each entity ₹5 lakh and given a duration of 45 days to pay the fine. SEBI found that these entities were involved in executing manipulative trades and carrying out trades with the connected parties.

154.title: Jos Buttler became boss Buttler: Aakash on England captain's 73(47) vs NZ
154.article_body: Praising Jos Buttler for his 47-ball 73 against New Zealand in T20 World Cup 2022, Aakash Chopra said, "Jos Buttler became boss Buttler and when he plays like that, amazing things happen." He added, "I'm saying there's no T20 batter better than him in the world at the moment." The England captain was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

155.title: Twitter discontinues ad-free articles for Blue subscribers: Report
155.article_body: Twitter will no longer allow subscribers of its Blue service to access ad-free articles, The Wall Street Journal reported citing sources. Twitter had described the ad-free feature as a way for publishers to earn more on a per-reader basis than they would from advertising. The report added that Twitter is planning to raise price of Blue to $19.99 from $4.99.

156.title: Congress is now a sinking ship: Haryana CM Khattar
156.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday said the Congress, which ruled the country for a long time, is now a sinking ship. He was campaigning for the bypoll in the Adampur assembly constituency. He also alleged that Congress was responsible for "crime, corruption and casteist politics" during its rule in the state.

157.title: Kejriwal, Mann should resign over air pollution in Delhi: BJP
157.article_body: The BJP on Tuesday said the poor quality of air in Delhi was due to the "criminal negligence" of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann. The BJP demanded the two Aam Aadmi Party chief ministers resign for the "poison" in the air. BJP National Spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said stubble-burning cases have increased in Punjab.

158.title: Kerala Guv advancing BJP's objectives, destabilising govt: CPI(M)
158.article_body: The CPI(M) accused Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan of advancing the BJP's objectives by attempting to destabilise the state's LDF government. "The manner in which he demanded the resignation of the vice-chancellors of various universities...has no sanction of the Indian Constitution," said the party. The CPI(M) added that Khan's steps "facilitate the promotion of the Hindutva" ideology.

159.title: Cheetahs released in Kuno to be moved to a 6-km enclosure
159.article_body: The eight cheetahs moved into Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh from Namibia in mid-September, will be moved into a 6-km soft release enclosure, said a member of a task force set up for them. Currently, the cheetahs are living in a quarantined enclosure where they're being provided food. After 3-4 months, the cheetahs will be shifted to the wild.

160.title: Police officer slaps job aspirant who came to meet K'taka Home Minister; video surfaces
160.article_body: A Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) slapped a constable job aspirant in Karnataka's Tumakuru on Tuesday. The incident happened when a group of job aspirants went to meet Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra to request him to raise the upper-age limit for constable jobs. A video of the incident showed the DSP pushing through the crowd to slap the man.

161.title: Sherlyn reacts to Rakhi Sawant’s mimicry of her, calls her 'nonsense’
161.article_body: Sherlyn Chopra has reacted to Rakhi Sawant's mimicry of her. In a video posted by a media account on Instagram, Sherlyn called Rakhi "nonsense". Rakhi had mimicked Sherlyn over her statements against #MeToo accused filmmaker Sajid Khan. "Why don't you join a gym...She...doesn't want to work hard but she'll go around media and paparazzi the whole time," Sherlyn added.

162.title: Form armour around BJP to protect development: PM to Gujarat voters
162.article_body: PM Narendra Modi urged Gujarat voters to form a "Suraksha Kavach (armour)" around the BJP government to "protect the development" that is ongoing in the state. "We are hardworking, honest people...the speed at which we are able to bring progress, we cannot let anyone dent this," said PM Modi. He added that Gujarat's development "is a must" for India's development.

163.title: India hands over 200 vehicles to Nepal for use in upcoming polls
163.article_body: India on Tuesday handed over 200 vehicles to Nepal for use by various Nepali institutions during the upcoming general elections in the country, a press release by the Indian Embassy said. The vehicles were handed over at the request of the Nepalese government, the communique added. Out of the 200 vehicles, 120 are for the security forces, the embassy informed.

164.title: Most victims of Seoul's Halloween stampede were women & youngsters
164.article_body: Most victims of the Halloween stampede in Seoul last Saturday were women and youngsters, the South Korean Interior and Safety Ministry said on Tuesday. The crowd crush killed 101 women and 55 men. As many as 104 people who died were in their 20s and 12 were teenagers. Over 100,000 people were reportedly present at the time of the stampede.

165.title: Belgium, Australia are favourites to win hockey WC 2023: Ex-Dutch defender
165.article_body: Former Netherlands defender Mink van der Weerden said that Australia and Belgium are the favourites to win the upcoming FIH Men's Hockey World Cup 2023. "They (Australia-Belgium) look very strong...I hope Netherlands can lift the WC...Hockey over the past 20 years has become more and more about fitness. The young players are becoming fitter at a young age," Weerden said.

166.title: Suresh Raina joins Abu Dhabi T10 League franchise Deccan Gladiators
166.article_body: Former India player Suresh Raina has joined the Abu Dhabi T10 League franchise Deccan Gladiators. Raina will play alongside Andre Russell, Nicholas Pooran, Jason Roy, Odean Smith and Taskin Ahmed for the Gladiators. Raina announced his retirement from IPL and BCCI cricket in September and it was reported he'll play in T20 leagues in South Africa, Sri Lanka and UAE.

167.title: Confident that BJP will form govt in Himachal: Jitendra Singh
167.article_body: Union minister Jitendra Singh on Tuesday said he is 100% confident that BJP will win the upcoming Assembly polls in Himachal Pradesh and form the government again. "The kind of environment that we are seeing here, it seems that...common people have decided that BJP government should be formed once again," Singh said. "Jairam ji will be the CM," he added.

168.title: All who are trying to lose weight will identify with 'Double XL': Farah
168.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan reviewed Sonakshi Sinha and Huma Qureshi's film 'Double XL' after attending a special screening. Farah stated that Sonakshi and Huma were "wonderful" in the film and added that Zaheer Iqbal and Mahat Raghavendra were "very cute". "All of us who are constantly dieting or trying to lose weight or everybody...will identify with it," she added.

169.title: England's Walker & Kalvin Phillips likely to recover before World Cup: Pep Guardiola
169.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said English footballers Kyle Walker and Kalvin Phillips are likely to recover from their injuries before the FIFA World Cup. "Kyle, I'm impressed how quick his recovery (is) but still a bit late compared to Kalvin," said Guardiola. Walker underwent groin surgery in early October, while Phillips has been sidelined due to a shoulder problem.

170.title: Russia fines Wikipedia owner $32,600 for not deleting Ukraine war entries
170.article_body: A Russian court on Tuesday fined Wikimedia Foundation, the owner of Wikipedia, 2 million roubles ($32,600) over articles relating to the Ukraine war. Stanislav Kozlovsky, head of the foundation's Russia chapter, said the penalty was imposed for not deleting entries that Russia has demanded be removed. Earlier this year, Russian authorities fined Wikimedia 5 million roubles over similar violations.

171.title: Days of 'raja-rani' are over, it's the time of common people: Shah in Himachal
171.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday criticised the Congress and said that in a democracy like India, the days of "raja-rani" are over, it is now the time of common people. Addressing a public rally in Himachal Pradesh ahead of Assembly polls, Amit Shah said, "Change this tradition of alternative governments and repeat the BJP in the state."

172.title: Govt proposes common ITR form for everyone, invites stakeholder comments
172.article_body: The Finance Ministry has proposed to introduce a common income tax return form for all taxpayers, under which income from virtual digital assets will have to be disclosed under a separate head. The Central Board of Direct Taxes has invited stakeholder comments on the form by December 15. All taxpayers, except trusts and non-profit organisations, can use the proposed form.

173.title: Star Sports urges fans to believe in blue as India look to end the wait
173.article_body: The Indian Cricket Team looks to return to winning ways against Bangladesh in the upcoming match as it aims to secure a berth in the semi-finals of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2022.
