Sports-lovers can tune in to watch the action LIVE on Star Sports & Disney+ Hotstar on Wednesday, November 2, 1 PM onwards.

174.title: Atmosphere was incredible: Ex-Dutch player recalls 2018 WC QF against India
174.article_body: Ex-Netherlands defender Mink van der Weerden recalled the 2018 FIH Men's Hockey World Cup quarter-final match against India which was played at Bhubaneswar's Kalinga Stadium. "The whole atmosphere was incredible...They were the most special circumstances I have ever played a game in...It was a full crowd that day and the home fans were loudly cheering for India," Weerden said.

175.title: Ex-Chief Secy Narain tampered with evidence: Andaman admin to SC
175.article_body: The Andaman and Nicobar Islands administration has told the Supreme Court (SC) that it has proof its former Chief Secretary Jitendra Narain, who is accused of gangrape and sexual abuse, "tampered with the evidence". Narain had directed the private operator of CCTV cameras to remove them, it said. Further, the Union Territory's administration challenged the anticipatory bail given to Narain.

176.title: Italy PM vows to tighten laws after illegal rave busted in Modena
176.article_body: Italian PM Giorgia Meloni vowed to tighten laws against unauthorised parties after police busted a rave in the city of Modena on Monday, which, according to residents, had been going on for two straight days. Police reportedly arrested 14 organisers of the illegal rave and confiscated audio equipment worth €150,000 (₹1,22,31,767). The party was purportedly organised in an abandoned warehouse.

177.title: Puneeth Rajkumar posthumously awarded Karnataka Ratna
177.article_body: Late Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar was posthumously awarded Karnataka Ratna at an event held in Bengaluru on Tuesday. The event was attended by Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai and actors Rajinikanth and Jr NTR. The award was received by Puneeth's wife. Several people attended the award ceremony amid heavy rainfall.

178.title: Odisha court sentences man to 20 yrs in jail for raping a minor, who's now his wife
178.article_body: A 25-year-old man, who married the girl he was accused of raping when she was a minor, was sentenced to 20 years in jail by a fast-track court in Odisha's Angul district. Last year, he married her after she turned 18. The judge, however, sentenced him, saying that such offences leave an indelible mark on the mind of the child.

179.title: Got into music after getting fired from job in New York: Prateek Kuhad
179.article_body: Singer Prateek Kuhad revealed he got into music after getting fired from a consulting firm in New York. "I got fired from my job...I was wondering what I could do now...I decided to take a year off and try this (music) out. I never liked doing that (job) anyway," he added. Prateek said he was "very frustrated" with the job.

180.title: T20 World Cup is a ruthless tournament: England captain Buttler
180.article_body: After England won their second match of T20 World Cup 2022 against New Zealand, England captain Jos Buttler said, "It's a ruthless tournament, last year South Africa went out despite having four wins out of five games." He added that his side had the confidence that showed up today and they didn't think too much about the past "poor performance".

181.title: PM Modi to inaugurate over 3,000 flats in Delhi tomorrow
181.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate 3,024 flats for economically weaker sections (EWS) at Kalkaji in South Delhi on Wednesday. He will hand over the keys to some of the beneficiaries of the in-situ slum rehabilitation project, a statement from Prime Minister's Office said. The flats have been built at a cost of ₹345 crore.

182.title: 8-ft-long crocodile enters house at night in UP in search of food, pic surfaces
182.article_body: A family in UP's Etawah woke up to find an eight-foot-long crocodile in their house. The home's owner said it entered the house at night in search of food when they were sleeping. They called police who told them to lock the reptile inside the house. They stayed awake throughout the night and the rescue operation started in the morning.

183.title: Rohith Vemula symbol of struggle against injustice: Rahul Gandhi
183.article_body: After he was joined by Radhika Vemula, Rohith Vemula's mother, in the morning leg of the Bharat Jodo Yatra, Rahul Gandhi said that Vemula is and will remain the symbol of his struggle against social discrimination and injustice. Rohith, a Dalit student, died by suicide in 2016 following alleged harassment. "By meeting Rohith's mother...the journey gained new courage", Rahul said.

184.title: India to overtake Germany as 4th largest economy by FY26: RBI Dy Guv
184.article_body: During an event, Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Deputy Governor Michael Patra said that India will overtake Germany to become the world's fourth-largest economy by 2025-26. By 2027, India will overtake Japan and become the third-largest economy, he said. "India's population will become the largest in the world next year...It'll demand the world's best financial intermediation services," he added.

185.title: I've got lot of experience, happy to help in any way I can: Smith
185.article_body: After not being played so far in the T20 World Cup, Australian batter Steve Smith said that he has a lot of experience and is happy to help in any way possible. "If you have got someone who is able to bat through...and let the hitters go around them, that has worked pretty well...I can play that role," Smith said.

186.title: Uber's Q3 revenue rises 72%, adjusted earnings hit record $516 million
186.article_body: Uber Technologies on Tuesday said its revenue for the July-September quarter was $8.34 billion, up 72% from last year. Meanwhile, the company's adjusted earnings hit record $516 million in Q3 and gross bookings also grew 26% to $29.12 billion. "Even as the macroeconomic environment remains uncertain, Uber's core business is stronger than ever," said Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi.

187.title: SC rejects plea to put candidates' age, education on ballots & EVMs
187.article_body: The Supreme Court declined to hear a plea directing the Election Commission to replace party symbols on ballots and electronic voting machines (EVMs) with age, educational qualifications and photographs of candidates. The petition, filed by advocate Ashwini Upadhyay, said this will help voters elect honest candidates and "control the dictatorship of political party bosses in ticket distribution".

188.title: I agreed to do 'Bhediya' after hearing just the one-line idea: Varun Dhawan
188.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan revealed he agreed to feature in 'Bhediya' after hearing the one-line idea. He added that he was in constant touch with producers as he didn't want to let go of 'Bhediya'. "My biggest dream as an actor is to entertain through a diverse array of roles. 'Bhediya' is the most important addition to that endeavour," he added.

189.title: Rohit was maybe not able to use his resources: Zaheer on India's loss vs SA
189.article_body: Zaheer Khan said that Rohit Sharma-led India got their T20 World Cup 2022 match against South Africa to that level from where they had to just finish it and they lost. He added, "10 overs and 94 to get. You created panic in...South African side...It felt like...to a certain degree that Rohit was maybe not able to use his resources."

190.title: SpaceX launches Falcon Heavy rocket after 3-year hiatus
190.article_body: SpaceX's Falcon Heavy was launched from the Kennedy Space Centre in Florida, for the first time in over three years. The mission, called USSF 44, included a rocket system having three Falcon 9 boosters strapped side-by-side with two US Space Force satellites. The Space Force asked SpaceX to end the launch live stream early and not show their deployment.

191.title: Conman's ₹10 cr claim attempt to divert attention from Morbi: Kejriwal
191.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said allegations that conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar paid ₹10 crore to AAP’s Satyendra Jain as “protection money” is an attempt to divert attention from the Morbi incident. "Before Punjab polls, they came out with Kumar Vishwas. Now, the BJP...has produced Sukesh,'' said Kejriwal. Chandrashekhar has reportedly claimed the same in a letter to Delhi LG VK Saxena.

192.title: Projects must respect sovereignty: Jaishankar at SCO meet hosted by China
192.article_body: Connectivity projects should respect the sovereignty and territorial integrity of member states of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO), External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said at a virtual meeting of SCO Council of Heads of Government. "Fair market access is to our mutual benefit and only way to move forward," he added. The meeting was hosted by Chinese Premier Li Keqiang.

193.title: Shocked to know of Gujarat bridge collapse, extend deep condolences: Chinese Prez
193.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has said he was "shocked" to learn about the deadly bridge collapse in Gujarat's Morbi that killed 135 people and injured over 100 others. "On behalf of the Chinese government and...people, I would like to express our deep condolences to the victims and extend our sincere sympathy to their families and the injured," he said.

194.title: Hurt by media trial: Raj Kundra on why he hides his face behind masks
194.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Raj Kundra wrote that he wears face masks for the media. "[I] don't wish to give the media a chance to click my face! I'm hurt by the media trial they put me through," he further tweeted. Raj was arrested in July 2021 in connection with the alleged creation and uploading of porn films on apps.

195.title: Develop techniques to conserve water resources: Prez to scientists
195.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu appealed to scientists, town planners and innovators to develop water resource conservation techniques. "There will be a need to effectively conserve water to meet the demands of our future generation and technology will play an important role," she said. Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat also said there is a need for a holistic approach to conservation.

196.title: Police shoots man after he drives through barricaded area in Omaha
196.article_body: A man was shot and wounded by a police officer on Monday night after the former recklessly drove his car through a barricaded area during a Halloween party in US' Omaha, police said. The driver's name has not yet been released. Police say no one else was injured in the incident that took place in Omaha's Minne Lusa neighbourhood.

197.title: Siddhant Chaturvedi dresses as Shaktimaan for Halloween, shares video
197.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi took to Instagram and shared a video of himself dressed as Pandit Gangadhar Shastri transforming into Shaktimaan for Halloween. In the video, Sidharth also revealed that he tore off the pants of his Shaktimaan costume. Along with the video, Siddhant wrote, "Sorry Shaktimaan." The actor recently featured in 'Gehraiyaan'.

198.title: Modi govt moving towards 'licence raj': Cong's Prithviraj Chavan
198.article_body: Congress leader and former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan criticised the Narendra Modi-led Centre over the issue of several major investments going to the state of Gujarat. "The way...Modi government is behaving it seems they are moving towards licence raj...which the Congress had brought to an end in the past," Chavan said. "It's not good for the country," he added.

199.title: Discussions on global spillovers one of the G20 priorities: FM Sitharaman
199.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that discussions on global spillovers will be one of the priorities on the agenda of India's upcoming G20 presidency. Sitharaman added, "How much can India and low- and middle-income countries bear the brunt of spillovers and how can you be ready for unpredictable spillovers?" India will be handed over G20 presidency in December from Indonesia.

200.title: AAP releases eighth list of 22 candidates for Gujarat Assembly polls
200.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Tuesday released its eighth list of 22 candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. It has nominated youth leader Yuvrajsinh Jadeja from Dahegam and Koli leader Raju Solanki, who joined the AAP last week, from Bhavnagar West. The AAP is the only party that has declared over 100 candidates for the elections so far.

201.title: Twitter's Chief Customer Officer Sarah resigns after Musk's takeover
201.article_body: Twitter's Chief Customer Officer Sarah Personette, who joined the company in 2018, resigned shortly after Elon Musk's Twitter takeover. "I wanted to share that I resigned on Friday from Twitter and my work access was officially cut off last night," Sarah tweeted. Earlier last week, Business Insider reported that she would get $11.2 million in payout.

202.title: Foodtech unicorn Rebel Foods raises ₹100 cr in debt funding
202.article_body: Foodtech unicorn Rebel Foods raised ₹100 crore in a debt funding round from InnoVen Capital and Trifecta Capital. The board of Rebel Foods also passed a resolution to issue 10,000 Series E non-convertible debentures at an issue price of ₹1,00,000 per share to raise ₹100 crore. So far, the Sequoia-backed startup has raised $536.5 million in funding.

203.title: Prez Murmu to visit Nagaland on Nov 2,3; to inaugurate schools, roads
203.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu will embark on a two-day visit to Nagaland on November 2 and 3, officials said. On her maiden visit to Nagaland after assuming office, President Murmu will virtually inaugurate newly constructed government schools, Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY) roads and Kohima Super Market. She is also scheduled to meet state ministers at Raj Bhavan in Kohima.

204.title: BJP, TRS workers clash on last day of Munugode bypoll campaign
204.article_body: A clash broke out between workers of Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) and BJP on the last day of the Munugode bypoll campaign on Tuesday. TRS MLC P Rajeshwar Reddy and MLA Peddi Sudarshan Reddy were among those injured in the incident. BJP state president Bandi Sanjay Kumar alleged that TRS is "unable to bear the massive response" received by BJP.

205.title: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorm warning issued for several states for next few days
205.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy rainfall warning for states/UTs including Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry from November 2 to 5. It stated thunderstorm accompanied with lightning is very likely over Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry from November 2 and 5. Thunderstorm accompanied with lightning is likely over Andhra Pradesh on November 2 and 3, it added.

206.title: Don't use my photos in Bharat Jodo Yatra publicity material: Digvijaya to Congress
206.article_body: Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh requested Congress' Madhya Pradesh unit to not use his photographs in the publicity material for Bharat Jodo Yatra. He said photos of former Congress Presidents Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, present party chief Mallikarjun Kharge and Kamal Nath should be used. State Congress spokesperson Narendra Saluja said Singh has been against publishing his photos for long.

207.title: Nearly 100 teaching job aspirants detained for blocking Kolkata road
207.article_body: Nearly 100 teaching job aspirants demanding appointment in schools were detained in Kolkata's Salt Lake area on Tuesday for blocking a road without informing authorities, a police officer said. The protestors claimed to have been deprived of teaching jobs despite having qualified in the recruitment tests conducted by the West Bengal School Service Commission.

208.title: 17-yr-old murdered by two men for not sharing WiFi hotspot password in Maha
208.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was murdered by two men for not giving them the WiFi hotspot password in the Kamothe area in Maharashtra's Navi Mumbai. "The two accused stabbed the victim after a fight broke out between them," said Vivek Pansare, DCP Zone-1, Navi Mumbai. Police said the two men were under the influence of alcohol when they committed the crime.

209.title: Was ousted from a film just before taking flight to shoot location: Anchal
209.article_body: Actress Anchal Singh, known for shows 'Yeh Kaali Kaali Ankhein' and 'Undekhi', revealed that she was once ousted from a film just before taking a flight to shoot location. Adding that she "felt awful", Anchal said, "It took time...to overcome that loss." Anchal further said now she's in a place where she feels secure when it comes to getting work.

210.title: Show me instance where BJP fought in favour of OBC reservation: Siddaramaiah
210.article_body: Speaking to reporters in Bengaluru, Congress leader Siddaramaiah asked them to show one instance where BJP has fought in favour of reservation for backward classes since Independence. The former Karnataka CM accused the BJP of being "anti-reservation". He also said that the centre's decision regarding the 10% reservation for the Economically Weaker Section was not in line with the Constitution.

211.title: Actor Anshuman Jha ties the knot with athlete Sierra Winters, shares pics
211.article_body: Actor Anshuman Jha, who has appeared in films like 'LSD: Love, Sex Aur Dhokha' and 'Pari', tied the knot with athlete Sierra Winters on October 29. The wedding took place in North Carolina, USA. Anshuman also shared pictures from his wedding on his Instagram handle. In an interview, he said, "I always wanted to find a partner who inspires me."

212.title: Tech Mahindra's attrition rate drops to 20%, hires 5,877 people in Q2
212.article_body: Tech Mahindra reported a decline in its attrition rate to 20% during the July-September quarter from 22% reported in the first quarter ended June 30, 2022. The company added 5,877 new hires in Q2, taking its total headcount to 1,63,912. "[We] believe that we need to manage headcount with...view to build future," Tech Mahindra CEO and MD CP Gurnani said.

213.title: 40 pistols & 36 magazines seized from car in MP, accused absconding
213.article_body: A cache of illegal weapons, including 40 pistols and 36 magazines, was seized from a car after a long chase by the police in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone district, Police Commissioner Harinarayanachari Mishra said on Tuesday. In a bid to avoid police, the driver increased the speed of the car and while escaping, hit a police vehicle, Mishra added.

214.title: Actress Kangana Ranaut is welcome to join BJP: JP Nadda
214.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda has stated that actress Kangana Ranaut is welcome to join the party. He added, "But as far as contesting the polls is concerned, it is not my decision alone...Everyone is welcome to join the BJP. But in what capacity, the party decides." Ranaut recently said she is willing to fight elections from Himachal Pradesh's Mandi.

215.title: Make double engine govt again & we'll make Himachal drug-free: Shah
215.article_body: Addressing a public rally in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said, "Make double engine government (BJP) again and we will make Himachal Pradesh drug-free." Notably, voting for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections will take place on November 12. The counting of votes will take place on December 8.

216.title: Credit to the way England played: NZ skipper Williamson after loss
216.article_body: After losing to England by 20 runs on Tuesday, New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson said that credit goes to their opponent for the way they played. "England put us under pressure. They played beautifully...they were clinical. It was a slightly above-par total. We tried to take it a little deep, but credit to the way they bowled," Williamson said.

217.title: Not the CEO you're looking for: Banker Parag as profile visits rise 36% after Twitter CEO's firing
217.article_body: After Parag Agrawal was fired as Twitter CEO, a banker with the same name as his, shared a screenshot showing a 36% surge in his LinkedIn profile visits. Sharing the data, he wrote, "To help folks with finding the right Parag, I've changed my profile page headline." Agrawal then updated his bio to, "Not the CEO you are looking for."

218.title: Bus carrying 35 passengers catches fire in Maharashtra, none hurt
218.article_body: A Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) bus carrying 35 passengers caught fire in the Pimpalvihir area on Amravati-Nagpur National Highway on Tuesday. As per reports, the bus driver spotted the fire and alarmed the passengers, who quickly got off the vehicle. Traffic on the highway came to a halt for almost an hour.

219.title: Ram Charan's film with 'Jersey' director Gowtam Tinnanuri shelved
219.article_body: Actor Ram Charan's publicist has confirmed that the actor's upcoming film with 'Jersey' director Gowtam Tinnanuri has been shelved. The film was tentatively named 'RC 16'. "Ram's new project announcement will be [unveiled] officially very soon, whatever the combo is, it will be lit," the actor's publicist tweeted. Ram is currently shooting for a project with filmmaker Shankar.

220.title: Crypto regulation a working priority in G20 Presidency: Sitharaman
220.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said framing crypto assets will be one of eight priorities that are still in the works for India's G20 Presidency. "I know work has been done by Financial Stability Board (FSB), OECD, IMF and the Bank for International Settlements (BIS)," she said. "So we will have to bring all of them together [for conversations]," she added.

221.title: New species of owl with unique call discovered in Africa
221.article_body: A new species of owl has been discovered in Príncipe, an island on the African west coast. The bird, called the Principe Scops-Owl, was first located by scientists in 2016, but suspicions of its existence started back in 1998. The bird has unique call of a short "tuu" note that repeats at a rate of about one note per second.

222.title: No moral conflict in buying Russian oil: Hardeep Singh Puri
222.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri said there was no moral conflict in buying Russian oil. Puri, in an interview, said the government has a moral duty to ensure that consumers are supplied with energy. Puri also said India will examine the prospect of a price cap on Russian oil, proposed by the G7 countries.

223.title: Virat Kohli coaches forward-press to KL Rahul ahead of Bangladesh match, video surfaces
223.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing Virat Kohli coaching forward-press to KL Rahul ahead of India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh. In the video, Kohli can be seen having a word with batting coach Vikram Rathour before advising Rahul. Rahul has scored 22 runs in three innings in the ongoing T20 World Cup 2022.

224.title: Insurtech platform Cover Genius raises $70 mn in Series D round
224.article_body: Insurtech platform Cover Genius, which offers embedded insurance, raised $70 million in its Series D funding round led by Dawn Capital. Existing investors GSquared and King River Capital, along with Atlas Merchant Capital also participated in the round. Authorised in nearly 60 countries, Cover Genius offers personalised insurance and warranty products along with instant claim payments.

225.title: Flipkart India's FY22 net loss increases to ₹3,413 crore
225.article_body: Flipkart India's consolidated net loss in the financial year 2021-22 increased to ₹3,413 crore, according to financial data accessed by business intelligence platform Tofler. However, Flipkart saw net total income both on a standalone and consolidated basis increase by about 18% to ₹51,175.7 crore. Flipkart's net loss on a standalone basis grew to ₹3,404.3 crore during the financial year.

226.title: RBI facilitates govt securities trading via digital rupee: Reports
226.article_body: The RBI has provided the Negotiated Dealing System-Order Matching (NDS-OM) platform to nine banks to trade in government securities using the central bank's digital currency as a pilot project, reports said. Transactions on the platform are settled instantly, reports added. "Over ₹100 crore of transactions had taken place by 12 pm on this platform," a source told Moneycontrol.

227.title: Goa bans drinking in public & other activities, warns of fines of up to ₹50,000
227.article_body: Goa Tourism Department has banned several activities like driving vehicles on beaches, unauthorised hawking, touting, begging and drinking in tourist places, in a bid to refine tourism. Listing these activities as "nuisance", the state government stated that either an action under the Indian Penal Code or a fine of ₹5,000 to ₹50,000 would be imposed on the violators.

228.title: World's largest iPhone factory worker walks 40 km to escape China's Covid lockdown
228.article_body: Dong Wanwan, a 20-year-old working at the world's largest iPhone factory run by Apple's supplier Foxconn in Zhengzhou, walked 40 kilometres to escape China's COVID-19 lockdown. The factory went into a "closed loop" after COVID-19 began spreading at the campus, Bloomberg reported. "Foxconn really messed up, I don't think a lot of people would want to go back," Wanwan said.

229.title: Tourists drive car on cable bridge in Karnataka, locals force them back; video surfaces
229.article_body: Days after over 130 people died in Morbi cable bridge collapse in Gujarat, a video of tourists driving a car on Shivapura hanging bridge in Karnataka has surfaced online. The video shows locals ensuring that the car is driven back from the bridge in reverse gear. The locals said the tourists were from Maharashtra.

230.title: Thank you for existing you crazy human being: Hrithik on Saba's b'day
230.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Instagram and wished his rumoured girlfriend and actress Saba Azad on her birthday. Along with her photo, the 'Vikram Vedha' actor wrote, "Thank you for existing you quirky crazy nutty anomaly of a human being." Saba had recently featured in the web series 'Rocket Boys', which also starred Jim Sarbh.

231.title: We found some consistency today: SL captain Shanaka on win vs Afghanistan
231.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said his side found some consistency in their six-wicket win against Afghanistan in T20 World Cup Super 12 stage match on Tuesday. "We're aiming to win our next game with a healthy run-rate which gives us a good chance to qualify [for semi-final]," he added. Sri Lanka are currently placed fourth in Group 1.

232.title: India have to be there: Mithali Raj predicts her finalists for T20 WC 2022
232.article_body: Ex-India Women captain Mithali Raj has picked her T20 World Cup 2022 finalists, saying, "India have to be there and New Zealand." She added, "My predictions for semi-final spot...will be India and South Africa from Group 2. From Group 1, it'll be New Zealand and a toss-up between England and Australia." India are currently second in Group 2 standings.

233.title: Pacers bowled too full, erred with our lines and lengths: Nabi on loss to SL
233.article_body: After losing to Sri Lanka on Tuesday and getting knocked out of the T20 World Cup, Afghanistan skipper Mohammad Nabi said that their pacers bowled "too full". "We erred with our lines and lengths. We gave away too many opportunities for them to hit...We got a good start in the powerplay. We didn't keep the momentum going," Nabi said.

234.title: Tulja Bhavani temple in Maha's Osmanabad to undergo renovation
234.article_body: The premises of Tulja Bhavani temple in Maharashtra's Osmanabad will be revamped and the sanctum will be inlaid with gold and silver, a district official said. A detailed project report for revamping the temple will be made in three months, District Collector Sachin Ombase said. Work will be carried out after considering disaster management principles to prevent overcrowding, he added.

235.title: US Senator calls for probe into Saudi firm's stake in Twitter
235.article_body: US Democratic Party Senator Chris Murphy on Monday called for a national security review of Saudi Arabia's Kingdom Holding Company's stake in Twitter Inc following Elon Musk's takeover of the social media company. Murphy said he was asking the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) to investigate "the national security implications of Saudi Arabia's purchase of Twitter".

236.title: I will break your legs: SFI leader tells Kerala college principal
236.article_body: A member of the Students' Federation of India (SFI), the student's wing of the CPI(M), along with his friends stormed into the office of a college principal in Kerala's Thrissur and issued him death threats. "If you continue to show hooliganism against the students here, I will break your legs," the leader was purportedly heard saying in a video.

237.title: Kapil Dev to make special appearance in Sonakshi, Huma's 'Double XL': Reports
237.article_body: Ex-India captain Kapil Dev will reportedly make a special appearance in 'Double XL', an upcoming film starring Sonakshi Sinha and Huma Qureshi. "He isn't featured as one of the cast members. Instead, the legendary veteran cricketer will be seen playing himself," a source was quoted as saying. Cricketer Shikhar Dhawan will also make his Bollywood debut with 'Double XL'.

238.title: Wishing a very happy birthday to a legend: Yuvraj to VVS Laxman
238.article_body: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter on VVS Laxman's 48th birthday and wrote, "Wishing a very happy birthday to a legend who showcased flawless class...character on the pitch and off it too! Have a good one Laxi." Mithali Raj tweeted, "Happy Birthday, Laxman. One of the finest batters to play for India and one who stood tall in adverse situations for...team."

239.title: Millions of microplastics come off Teflon-coated pans during cooking: Study
239.article_body: According to a study, thousands to millions of ultrasmall plastic particles are released into food while cooking in a Teflon-coated non-stick pan. Just a single small crack on the surface of such a pan can release about 9,100 plastic particles, the study stated. Teflon is the brand name of Polytetrafluoroethylene, a kind of PFAS that has several health risks.

240.title: L-G Saxena forms panel to boost Delhi's night-time economy
240.article_body: Lieutenant Governor (L-G) VK Saxena has formed a committee to ease the process to issue licences to restaurants and hotels, in a bid to give impetus to Delhi's night-time economy. "The L-G has directed the committee to submit its report/recommendations in 15 days," said the L-G house. The move follows a recent decision to allow 314 establishments to operate 24X7.

241.title: Detailed inquiry into Morbi bridge collapse is need of hour: PM Modi
241.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said a detailed and extensive inquiry to identify all aspects relating to the Morbi bridge collapse is the need of the hour. He chaired a high-level meeting to review the situation. PM Modi added that key learnings from the inquiry must be implemented at the earliest.

242.title: 4 mn vehicles renewed PUC papers in last 10 months in Delhi: Report
242.article_body: The owners of about 4 million vehicles in Delhi renewed their Pollution Under Control (PUC) documents in the last 10 months, according to the Transport Department's data. The development came as the Delhi government on October 12 announced that vehicles without PUC papers would be barred from refuelling in the Capital. The government rescinded the order on October 25.

243.title: I don't think B'wood is facing any negativity, my films did well: Anupam
243.article_body: Veteran actor Anupam Kher said in an interview that Bollywood is not facing any negativity, adding that two of his films have emerged as blockbusters this year. "I say it proudly, 'The Kashmir Files' did ₹350 crore, 'Karthikeya 2' did ₹130 crore. I'm riding on ₹480 crore right now," he said, adding, "If it's a good film, it'll do well."

244.title: 9 rescued, dozens missing after migrant boat sinks off Greek island
244.article_body: A search and rescue operation was launched on Tuesday for dozens of migrants after their boat capsized and drowned off the coast of a Greek island near the capital Athens. The Greek Coast Guard said nine survivors, all men, had been found on an uninhabited islet. According to the rescued men, nearly 68 people were on board the ill-fated vessel.

245.title: Pic of B'luru auto carrying toffees, books for commuters goes viral
245.article_body: A picture of an autorickshaw carrying sanitisers and snacks like biscuits and toffees for passengers in Bengaluru has gone viral on Twitter. The picture showed that driver Rajesh also keeps devotional books, water bottles and bandages in his vehicle. A netizen said, "Even the cabs of Ola, Uber [and] Meru...don't have anything like this considering that they charge much more!"

246.title: Accident victim's sister to get free education: Bangalore University
246.article_body: Bangalore University (BU) has decided to provide free education to the younger sister of Shilpashree, the 23-year-old postgraduate student who died in a road accident inside the campus last month. The victim's family, however, said the university had promised a government job. Some of the university staff have also decided to donate one day's salary to the victim's family.

247.title: PM respected abroad because of India’s deep-rooted democracy: Gehlot
247.article_body: Congress leader and Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday said PM Narendra Modi gets respect globally because of India's deep-rooted democracy. "[PM Modi] gets the respect because he is the Prime Minister of the country of Gandhi, where the roots of democracy run deep and where, even after more than 70 years of independence, democracy is alive," CM Gehlot said.

248.title: L&T fined ₹5 lakh, ordered to stop work at BJP office in Delhi: Report
248.article_body: Delhi government has reportedly issued a notice to stop construction work at a BJP office in Delhi. Further, the government has fined construction agency Larsen & Toubro (L&T) ₹5 lakh for violating construction ban in Delhi. Taking to Twitter, Delhi Minister Gopal Rai said, "Huge irregularities found at BJP's under construction office site during surprise inspection under 'Anti Dust Campaign'."

249.title: Bengal won't be left out of CAA implementation process: BJP's Suvendu
249.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Tuesday claimed the process of CAA implementation has started in the country and West Bengal won't be left out. "The Matua community members and other backward castes like Namasudras will get...benefits soon," Adhikari said. His comment comes after the Centre decided to grant Indian citizenship to minorities mostly from Pakistan, who have migrated to India.

250.title: Johnson & Johnson to buy Abiomed for $16.6 billion
250.article_body: Johnson & Johnson (J&J) said it will buy cardiovascular technology company Abiomed for $16.6 billion to strengthen its medical device segment. Abiomed, which develops technology to treat coronary artery disease and heart failure, will run as a standalone business within J&J once the deal is completed. J&J will pay for the acquisition with a combination of cash and short-term financing.

251.title: I have been forced to come out as bisexual: 18-year-old actor Kit Connor
251.article_body: Actor Kit Connor, who plays a bisexual character in the show 'Heartstopper', tweeted, "I'm [bisexual]. Congrats for forcing an 18-year-old to out himself. I think some of you missed the point of the show." It's being speculated this was in response to allegations of queerbaiting. The allegations surfaced after Connor was spotted holding hands with his female co-star Maia Reficco.

252.title: How does T20 World Cup 2022 Group 1 points table read with 1 match each left?
252.article_body: New Zealand, England and Australia are the top three teams with five points each on Group 1 points table in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage. New Zealand are on top with a superior net run-rate. Sri Lanka are placed fourth with four points, followed by Ireland. Afghanistan have been eliminated from the semifinals race.

253.title: Women students whipped by Taliban officer while protesting burqa policy, video out
253.article_body: A video has shown female students in Afghanistan getting assaulted after they protested a ban on their entry to a university for not wearing a burqa. The incident reportedly took place outside the gates of Badakhshan University on Sunday. A member of the Taliban's vice and virtue force was seen chasing after students with a whip.

254.title: AAP protest in Bengaluru after city potholes claim two more lives
254.article_body: The AAP staged a protest at Bengaluru's Freedom Park following the death of two youths due to potholes in the city. "It is a state-sponsored massacre. The shameless government...is committing crimes by killing innocent lives," said AAP. The party claimed that the state government delays releasing funds for road repairs if contractors do not agree to pay a commission.

255.title: Rapper Takeoff shot dead at 28 reportedly 'over a game of dice' in US
255.article_body: American rapper Takeoff, who was best known as a member of the hip-hop trio 'Migos', was shot dead at the age of 28 outside a club in Houston, US. Takeoff, whose real name is Kirshnik Khari Ball, was shot dead by a person after a fight reportedly broke out during a dice game. He was pronounced dead on the scene.

256.title: Uber may restrict auto services in some parts of Bengaluru: Official
256.article_body: Ride-hailing platform Uber on Tuesday said it's considering restricting auto-rickshaw services in some parts of Bengaluru. Uber India Head of Central Operations Nitish Bhushan said Uber won't be able to operate within the current 10% commission cap rules in Bengaluru as per Karnataka High Court's temporary orders. "We want to work with the government on appropriate fare regulations," Uber stated.

257.title: DMK leader, who called actresses in Tamil Nadu BJP 'items', booked
257.article_body: DMK leader Saidai Sadiq has been booked for allegedly making derogatory remarks against actresses-turned-BJP leaders in Tamil Nadu. He had called BJP leaders Gayathri Raguramm, Namitha and Gautami "items" and mocked Kushboo Sundar. Sadiq had also said that unlike the DMK, BJP depended on the "actresses" to make inroads into Tamil Nadu.

258.title: Twitter Co-founder Dorsey retains 2.4% indirect stake in company
258.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey retained a 2.4% indirect stake in the company under the new ownership of Elon Musk, according to a US Securities and Exchange Commission filing. The value of Dorsey's over 18 million shares is nearly $1 billion, the filing revealed. Notably, Musk will serve as Twitter CEO after he completed the $44-billion acquisition on Thursday.

259.title: UP govt to give ₹17,500 'encouragement allowance' to youths for start-up
259.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government is planning to provide a monthly 'encouragement allowance' of ₹17,500 to the youths for a year for setting up businesses. As per the policy, financial assistance of ₹5 lakh would be given to the start-up for making a new product and another grant of ₹7.5 lakh would be given for its launch in the market.

260.title: Delhi HC upholds life sentence of stalker who killed DU student Radhika
260.article_body: The Delhi High Court has upheld the life sentence awarded to the man who murdered Delhi University (DU) student Radhika Tanwar in 2011. Dismissing Vijay Saini's appeal against the conviction, the court said, "[His guilt]...has been proved beyond reasonable doubt." Vijay allegedly stalked Radhika and when she rejected his advances, he shot her with a pistol in a premeditated act.

261.title: How can Punjab's pollution reach Delhi? Minister on Delhi's air pollution
261.article_body: Punjab Agriculture Minister Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal on Tuesday said Punjab's stubble is not the cause of pollution in Delhi. "Rohtak, Panipat and Sonepat are the ones contributing to Delhi's pollution. How can Punjab's pollution reach Delhi? How can Amritsar's, and not Panipat's smoke, reach Delhi?" he said. "Centre is the only one responsible for this mess," Dhaliwal added.

262.title: Srinagar-Leh highway closed after rainfall, light snowfall in J&K
262.article_body: The Srinagar-Leh highway was closed for traffic after Jammu and Kashmir experienced rainfall and light snowfall, officials said on Tuesday. "The weather is cloudy and snowfall is going on at...few places particularly in Zojila and Sonamarg higher reaches," Mukhtar Ahmad, Deputy Director of IMD, said. In a tweet, traffic department said that Srinagar-Jammu highway and Mughal Road were open.

263.title: It was wake-up call: Madan Lal on India's loss vs South Africa in T20 WC
263.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Madan Lal said the loss against South Africa in ongoing T20 World Cup was a wake-up call for Team India. "Because we didn't perform as we would've liked...I'd like to commend the bowlers because, at one stage, we thought that we could win the match," he added. South Africa chased the 134-run target with two balls to spare.

264.title: WhatsApp bans over 26 lakh Indian accounts in September
264.article_body: WhatsApp on Saturday said that it banned over 26 lakh Indian accounts in September 2022. According to WhatsApp's monthly report, the Meta-owned platform received 666 grievance reports from India, of which 496 reports pertained to a 'ban appeal'. The rest of the reports were under categories such as support and safety, the platform added in its report.

265.title: Max Healthcare's net profit rises 216.18% YoY to ₹457 cr in Q2
265.article_body: Max Healthcare Institute on Tuesday reported a 216.18% rise in its consolidated net profit to ₹457.35 crore in the July-September quarter, as against ₹144.65 crore in the year-ago period. The healthcare provider's revenue from operations stood at ₹1,137.12 crore during the quarter, up from ₹1,019.26 crore. The company reported that total expenses increased to ₹897.72 crore.

266.title: Wannabe PM Rahul should first convince his people to elect him as MP: KTR
266.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao (popularly known as KTR) commented on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's remarks about TRS' plans to convert into a national party. "International leader Rahul Gandhi who can't even win his own parliament seat in Amethi ridicules Telangana CM KCR's national party ambitions...Wannabe PM should first convince his people to elect him as an MP," KTR said.

267.title: India uses e-rupee to settle ₹2.75 billion of government bonds
267.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's central bank-backed digital rupee was used to settle secondary market transactions in Indian government bonds worth ₹2.75 billion as part of a pilot. Data showed that trades in a total of three securities – five-year 7.38% 2027 former benchmark 6.54% 2032 and the current benchmark 7.26% 2032 bonds – were settled under the new route.

268.title: 21, including 19 minors, drown during Chhath Puja rituals across Bihar
268.article_body: At least 21 people, including 19 minors, have drowned in separate incidents during Chhath Puja celebrations across Bihar since Sunday. Two boys aged 9 and 13 drowned while cleaning the ghat and a 10-year-old boy drowned while offering 'arghya' in Patna district. Three children from same family also drowned while bathing in Purnea. Many have been reported missing across Bihar.

269.title: Leopard dies after being hit by vehicle on B'luru-Mysuru Expressway
269.article_body: A leopard aged about three years died after allegedly being hit by an unidentified vehicle on the Bengaluru-Mysuru Expressway on Monday morning. The incident took place in Ramanagara district, 50 km from Bengaluru. Forest officials said the speeding vehicle might have hit the animal on its head. A police officer said there are no speed breakers on the expressway.

270.title: Tech Mahindra reports 4% fall in net profit in Q2 at ₹1,285 crore
270.article_body: Tech Mahindra released its results for the Q2 of 2022-23, reporting a 4% fall in consolidated post tax profit to ₹1,285 crore. The company had reported a net profit of ₹1,339 crore in the year-ago period. The company's overall revenue increased to ₹13,129 crore from ₹10,881 crore in the same period last year, registering a 20.7% growth.

271.title: 'Diwale Dulhania...' to re-release in select theatres on SRK's b'day
271.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's 1995 film 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' will re-release on November 2 to mark the actor's 57th birthday. As per Yash Raj Films' Instagram post, the film will release in PVR, INOX and Cinepolis theatres across India. 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', directed by Aditya Chopra, also featured Kajol and late actor Amrish Puri.

272.title: Temple chariot collapses in K'taka; video shows devotees running to safety
272.article_body: A chariot fell down due to a broken wheel while it was being carried by devotees during 'Rathotsava' at Sri Veerabhadreshwara Temple in Karnataka's Chamarajanagar. No injury has been reported so far. In a video that has surfaced on social media, devotees are seen running to safety as soon as the chariot collapsed.

273.title: Decomposed body of man travels nearly 900 km in toilet of Jansewa Express
273.article_body: The decomposed body of an unidentified man was recovered from a toilet in Jansewa Express at Uttar Pradesh's Roza Railway Station. The body travelled at least 900 km undetected from Bihar's Banmankhi station. The GRP personnel broke open the toilet door after passengers complained of a foul smell emanating from inside. No ID card was found on him, police said.

274.title: IAEA begins probe of Russian claim about Kyiv making 'dirty bombs'
274.article_body: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) on Monday said it had started inspection of two Ukrainian nuclear sites where Russia claims Kyiv is manufacturing "dirty bombs" for use in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. The inspections had been requested by Kyiv in the wake of the accusations. Both sites being investigated "have been visited regularly by IAEA inspectors", the agency said.

275.title: Monkey roams around in Delhi Metro station, clears security check
275.article_body: A video of a monkey roaming around in a Delhi Metro station has gone viral on social media. In the video, the monkey can be seen casually walking and making its way to clear the security check at Nawada station of Blue Line Metro. Reacting to the video, an Instagram user wrote, "Token toh lele [Take the token]."

276.title: FirstMeridian Business Services gets SEBI's approval for ₹800 crore IPO
276.article_body: SEBI has given its approval to staffing firm FirstMeridian Business Services to raise up to ₹800 crore through an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO will include a fresh issue of equity shares worth up to ₹50 crore and an Offer for Sale (OFS) worth up to ₹750 crore by promoters and existing shareholders.

277.title: Why is NASA preparing to shine a 'flashlight' on the Moon's surface?
277.article_body: NASA has said its 'Lunar Flashlight' (a small satellite the size of a briefcase) is ready to launch in November. The satellite will use lasers "to search for water ice inside the darkest craters at the Moon's South Pole", NASA said. The satellite, that'll be launched on a SpaceX rocket, will take three months to reach its science orbit.

278.title: AIMIM aligned with BJP, its 'only job' is to cut votes of Cong: Jairam
278.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Tuesday criticised the AIMIM, saying the party is aligned with the BJP and its "only job" is to fight polls to cut votes of the Congress. "There's no doubt that they take oxygen from the BJP and AIMIM gives booster dose to the BJP," Ramesh said. His comment comes as 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' reached Hyderabad.

279.title: Building a product to disrupt LinkedIn, to make resumes irrelevant: Unacademy CEO
279.article_body: Unacademy Group's Founder and CEO Gaurav Munjal on Tuesday said that the edtech startup's R&D team is working on a product that wants to disrupt LinkedIn. He asked Twitter users for suggestions on naming the new product and he also suggested four names - 'ProjectX', 'nextlevel', 'Unprofile' and 'Jobkey'. In another tweet, he said, "We want to make resumes irrelevant."

280.title: Ban on loud music post 10 pm only in Jubilee Hills pubs in Hyd: HC
280.article_body: The Telangana High Court has lifted restrictions on playing loud music in Hyderabad pubs after 10 pm with the exception of those in the neighbourhood of Jubilee Hills. In September, a single judge bench of the HC had banned all pubs from playing loud music after 10 pm and ordered adherence to permissible noise levels.

281.title: Online gaming unicorn Games24x7 launches ₹400 cr fund for startups
281.article_body: Online gaming unicorn Games24x7 launched a ₹400 crore fund to invest in interactive entertainment startups. The fund will be used over the next five years and Chief Financial Officer Rahul Tewari said the money will come from its own balance sheet. Founded by Bhavin Pandya and Trivikraman Thampy, Games24x7 raised $75 million earlier this year at a $2.5 billion valuation.

282.title: Police seize drugs worth ₹85 lakh in Mumbai's Wadala, 1 arrested
282.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Monday seized drugs worth ₹85 lakh from Wadala and arrested one person, 28-year-old Zahid Tipu Sultan Khan, in the case. According to police, at around 11 pm, they spotted a man on a bike and checking led to the recovery of around 16.18 kg of charas. Police have registered a case under sections of NDPS Act.

283.title: Massive asteroid that could pose threat to Earth found hiding in Sun's glare
283.article_body: Astronomers discovered three near-Earth asteroids hiding in Sun's glare. One of them is the largest "potentially hazardous" object spotted in last eight years, according to NOIRLab. "Our...survey is scouring...area within...orbits of Earth...We've found two large near-Earth asteroids that are about 1 km across, a size...we call planet killers," said an astronomer on two of the three asteroids.

284.title: Our son put Riteish and me on the road to veganism: Genelia
284.article_body: On the occasion of World Vegan Day, actor-couple Genelia Deshmukh and Riteish Deshmukh spoke about turning vegan. Genelia credited their son for putting her and Riteish "on the road to veganism". "He...told me, 'Aai, you love Flash (our dog) and you eat chicken...Both are animals. What's the difference?' That put me on...road to understanding what I was doing," she said.

285.title: Dog owner beats security guard with stick in Gurugram; video viral
285.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media, showing a dog owner allegedly beating a security guard with a stick on Saturday in Gurugram. The incident took place when the man, who is reportedly a society member, was stopped by the guard from walking his dog in a part of the society. The guard suffered severe injuries in the incident.

286.title: Was duped by a staff member, I trusted her way too much: Urfi
286.article_body: 'Bigg Boss OTT' fame Urfi Javed in a recent interview revealed that she was duped by a staff member, leading to her losing several lakhs of money. "It was my fault...I trusted her way too much," she added. Urfi further said she doesn't intend to file any complaints against the former staff member, as "she was once dear" to her.

287.title: Over 75 planes of Indian carriers grounded due to technical issues: CAPA
287.article_body: Global aviation consultancy firm CAPA said on Tuesday that more than 75 planes of Indian carriers are currently grounded due to maintenance and engine-related issues. The planes, accounting for around 10-12% of Indian fleet, will have a significant impact on financials in the second half, CAPA said. CAPA added that non-supply issues are also expected to emerge next year.

288.title: Sun Pharma Q2 profit rises 10.5% YoY to ₹2,262 cr, revenue up 14%
288.article_body: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries on Tuesday reported a 10.5% year-over-year increase in its consolidated net profit to ₹2,262 crore in the July-September quarter. The company saw a nearly 14% rise in its total revenue from operations at ₹10,952 crore from ₹9,626 crore in the year ago quarter. Shares of the pharma major closed at ₹1,033 on BSE.

289.title: PM Modi meets those injured in Morbi bridge collapse at civil hospital
289.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday visited Morbi civil hospital where over 100 people injured in the suspension bridge collapse are admitted. At least 135 people were killed in the incident. Pictures showed PM Modi enquiring about a patient's health at the hospital. The hospital was painted overnight for PM Modi's visit.

290.title: Fintech startup Decentro raises $4.7 million in Series A round
290.article_body: Decentro, a Y Combinator-backed startup that helps firms enter the fintech market, has secured $4.7 million in Series A funding round. The round was led by Singapore and US-based Rapyd Ventures, US-based Uncorrelated Ventures and Leonis VC from Europe. Angel investors, including CRED Founder Kunal Shah, Groww CEO Lalit Keshre and Gupshup CEO Beerud Sheth also participated in the round.

291.title: Shubman Gill smashes highest score by an Indian in a T20 knockout match
291.article_body: Punjab opener Shubman Gill on Tuesday smashed his first-ever hundred in T20 cricket. The 23-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 49 deliveries and went on to score 126(55) against Karnataka in quarter-final match of Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) 2022. Shubman's 126 is also the highest score by an Indian in a T20 knockout match.

292.title: Shubman Gill smashes his first-ever hundred in T20 cricket
292.article_body: Punjab opener Shubman Gill on Tuesday smashed his first-ever hundred in T20 cricket. The 23-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 49 deliveries and went on to score 126(55) against Karnataka in quarter-final match of Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) 2022. Shubman's 126 is also the highest score by an Indian in a T20 knockout match.

293.title: Twitter bans over 54,000 accounts in India for sexual, terror content
293.article_body: Twitter has banned 52,141 accounts in India for promoting child sexual exploitation and non-consensual nudity between August 26 and September 25. Twitter, now owned by Elon Musk, removed 1,982 accounts for promoting terrorism. In a monthly report, Twitter said it received 157 complaints from users in India in the same time-frame, out of which action was taken on 129 URLs.

294.title: Pune-based DPSU disposes of 258 tonnes of scrap, makes ₹1.48 crore
294.article_body: Pune-based Defence Public Sector Undertaking Munitions India Limited (MIL) has disposed of 258 tonnes of scrap from its various units. It's earned ₹1.48 crore from the scrap disposal, Indian Express quoted officials as saying. Moreover, 600 tonnes of scrap has been identified that will be disposed of soon. Notably, this was done as part of government's Special Campaign 2.0 initiative.

295.title: Man dies after being pushed off building by robbers in Thane
295.article_body: A 26-year-old vegetable vendor died after he was pushed off a five-storey building by three unidentified men who allegedly robbed him of ₹12,000 in Mumbra, Thane. The incident happened when the deceased, Sujit Rajaram Gupta, had come to the building to collect empty vegetable crates, police said. A case has been registered under IPC sections 302 and 397.

296.title: England hand NZ their first defeat in T20 World Cup 2022, go 2nd on points table
296.article_body: England defeated New Zealand by 20 runs in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 1 match on Tuesday. With this, New Zealand suffered their first defeat in the ongoing tournament. New Zealand, England and Australia have accumulated five points each. New Zealand are on top of the table with superior net run-rate (NRR), while England are now second.

297.title: Income Tax Dept raids Cartier, Rolex retailer Kapoor Watch Company: Report
297.article_body: The Income Tax Department is conducting searches at Kapoor Watch Company, the Indian retailer of Audemars Piguet, Bvlgari, Cartier, Omega and Tag Heuer brands, as per a report. Sources said that around 20 premises were covered in this search which started on Monday morning. All the showrooms and premises of its promotors were covered in this search, the report added.

298.title: New pic of SRK & Deepika Padukone from 'Pathaan' sets leaks online
298.article_body: A new picture of Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone has leaked from the sets of their upcoming film 'Pathaan', which is going viral on social media platforms. Reportedly, the makers are planning to release the teaser of 'Pathaan' on November 2 to mark Shah Rukh's 57th birthday. The film, directed by Siddharth Anand, will release on January 25, 2023.

299.title: Finnish PM urges Hungary, Turkey to swiftly approve Finland, Sweden's NATO bids
299.article_body: Finland's Prime Minister Sanna Marin has urged Hungary and Turkey to swiftly approve Finland and Sweden's applications for NATO membership. The two Nordic countries asked to join NATO in May in response to Russian invasion of Ukraine but faced objections from Turkey, which accused the nations of giving shelter to groups it considers as terrorists.

300.title: Kartik Aaryan, Kiara Advani's pics from 'Satyaprem...' shoot get leaked
300.article_body: Leaked pics of Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani from their shoot for 'Satyaprem Ki Katha' have surfaced. Both of them are currently shooting in Ahmedabad. In one of the leaked pictures, Kiara can be seen sitting behind Kartik on a scooter. After 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', this will be the second time when Kiara and Kartik will be working together.

301.title: I appeal to innovators to develop techniques to conserve water: Prez Murmu
301.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu stressed on water conservation and appealed to scientists, town planners and innovators to try to develop techniques that will help conserve water resources. "There will be a need to effectively conserve water to meet the demands of our future generation and technology will play an important role in it," said the President.

302.title: Adani Ports Q2 profit rises by 69% to ₹1,677.48 cr, revenue up by 33%
302.article_body: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (Adani Ports) reported a 68.5% year-on-year surge in September quarter profit to ₹1,677.48 crore. Consolidated revenue from operations grew by 32.8% to ₹5,210.80 crore as cargo volume increased by 15% year-on-year to 86.6 million metric tonnes. The revenue from port and SEZ activities rose to ₹4,609.29 crore.

303.title: PM Modi visits site of Morbi bridge collapse that killed 135 people
303.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday visited the site of the Morbi bridge collapse which killed at least 135 people and injured around 100 others. Videos and photos from the site showed PM surveying the rescue work and meeting people carrying out the relief operations. He emphasised ensuring that all possible assistance was reaching the affected persons, PMO said.

304.title: 24-yr-old youth arrested for looting 60 sacks of onions in Prayagraj
304.article_body: A 24-year-old youth was arrested for allegedly looting around 60 sacks of onions, along with his two accomplices, from two persons who were carrying the consignment from Prayagraj’s Jasra mandi to Pratapgarh on October 30. The youth, who was staying in Holland Hall hostel illegally, along with his accomplices purportedly held the victims captive for hours in the hostel.

305.title: Tata Motors' total sales rise by 15.5% to 78,335 units in October
305.article_body: Tata Motors said it registered a total sale of 78,335 units in October, witnessing a growth of 15.49%. The company had sold a total of 67,829 units in the same month last year. Tata said total domestic sales were at 76,537 units as against 65,151 units in the year-ago month, an increase of 17%.

306.title: Boss hits junior with clock for failing to meet monthly sales target in Mumbai
306.article_body: A 35-year-old man reportedly hit his junior with table clock after he failed to meet his monthly target of selling health insurance plans in Mumbai. Anand Singh resigned after missing the target and asked the accused, Amit Singh, for incentives, which he denied. When Anand demanded to discuss the matter before other employees, Amit lost his cool and hit him.

307.title: Macau tests 7 lakh residents after detecting 11 COVID-19 cases
307.article_body: Macau, the world's biggest gambling hub, carried out mass testing of its 7,00,000 residents on Tuesday after detecting 11 cases of COVID-19 in the past few days. Authorities had locked down a major casino in the city on Sunday, ordering staff and guests to stay inside until November 1. More than 1,500 people are reportedly sealed inside the casino.

308.title: Aus survivor of Halloween stampede in Seoul blames govt for mismanagement
308.article_body: Nathan Taverniti, 24-year-old Australian who survived stampede that killed over 150 people in Seoul, blamed officials for failing to employ crowd control measures despite anticipating massive turnout during Halloween festivities, The Associated Press reported. Taverniti said there should have been enough police on standby. "This incident is a result of government's mismanagement," Taverniti said.

309.title: Jos Buttler breaks record for smashing most runs for England in T20I cricket history
309.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler on Tuesday broke the record for scoring most runs for England in T20I cricket history. With his 73(47) against New Zealand in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Tuesday, Buttler took his tally of runs in T20I cricket to 2,468. He overtook the previous record of 2,458 runs held by ex-England captain Eoin Morgan.

310.title: 22-yr-old Hyd woman who 'jumped' from 5th floor in UAE is alive: Embassy
310.article_body: A 22-year-old Hyderabadi woman who was assumed to be dead after falling from the fifth floor of a building in the UAE is currently undergoing treatment at a hospital, the Indian Embassy in Dubai said. Majlis Bachao Tehreek leader Amjed Ullah Khan said Afsha Begum, who worked as a housemaid in Ajman, had attempted suicide by jumping from the building.

311.title: After 'Chief Twit', Musk changes Twitter bio to 'Twitter Complaint Hotline Operator'
311.article_body:
Elon Musk on Tuesday changed his bio from 'Chief Twit' to 'Twitter Complaint Hotline Operator' and changed his profile picture to a photo of his younger self that is holding a telephone. Musk has been engaging with several Twitter users after reports alleged that the social media company 
may charge its users around $20 for the blue tick verification badge.

312.title: What if I couldn't go to Harvard?: Co-founder as boAt becomes Harvard case study
312.article_body: Electronics maker boAt's Co-founder Aman Gupta on Tuesday took to Instagram to share the news that Harvard Business School has written a case study on boAt. "Harvard Nahee Jaa sake to Kya hua...apna kaam aur apnee company pahucha dee (What if I couldn't go to Harvard? I sent my company and work to Harvard)," he wrote.

313.title: Sh*t version of my film: Kolkata filmmaker on T-Series' 'Mister Mummy'
313.article_body: Kolkata filmmaker Akash Chatterjee has demanded T-Series to credit him for Riteish Deshmukh's film, titled 'Mister Mummy'. In a Facebook post, Akash Chatterjee alleged that T-Series "stole" the script of his film and came up with their "sh*t version" of it. He also shared that his story and concept are registered with Screenwriters Association, Mumbai.

314.title: MMRDA launches 2nd of longest steel decks on Mumbai Trans Harbour Link
314.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) launched the second of the longest (180 metre) orthotropic steel decks on the Mumbai Trans Harbour Link, a sea link that will connect South Mumbai to Navi Mumbai. The first 180-metre-long steel deck was launched in March 2022. These steel decks weigh as heavy as six large-sized aircraft.

315.title: UPL's Q2 net profit rises by 28% to ₹814 crore, revenue up by 18%
315.article_body: Global crop protection products manufacturer UPL posted a 28.4% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit at ₹814 crore as against ₹633 crore in the corresponding quarter last fiscal. The company's consolidated revenue from operations surged by 18% year-on-year to ₹12,506 crore. UPL's stock fell by 2.14% on the NSE after the results and it closed 1.63% lower at ₹718.30 apiece.

316.title: 50-yr-old woman suffers stroke after nerve gets pressed during hair wash at Hyd salon
316.article_body: A 50-year-old woman suffered a 'beauty parlour stroke' after getting a hair wash at a salon in Hyderabad. Doctors treating her said that a key vessel supplying blood to the brain was pressed when she bent back her neck for the wash. The term 'beauty parlour stroke syndrome' was coined after it was first reported in 1993 in US.

317.title: BJP's ideology favours rising air pollution: Delhi minister Gopal Rai
317.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai criticised the BJP and said that its ideology favours rising air pollution levels as the party voiced support for the bursting of firecrackers. "Punjab would have seen a large-scale reduction in stubble burning had the Centre supported the state government's initiative to provide a cash incentive to farmers for not burning crop residue," he said.

318.title: Survey of 62,000 hawkers & vendors starts in Pune district
318.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has started a biometric survey of 62,000 hawkers and vendors in the region. Government norms make it mandatory for all civic bodies to survey hawkers every five years. The agency that will conduct the survey will get ₹60 for surveying each hawker.

319.title: 730 crore UPI transactions worth over ₹12 lakh crore conducted in Oct
319.article_body: About 730 crore transactions worth ₹12.11 lakh crore were conducted through Unified Payments Interface (UPI) platform in October, NPCI data showed. This is a 7.7% increase in transaction volume as compared to September's 678 crore transactions. Meanwhile, the number of instant interbank fund transfers through IMPS in October stood at 48.25 crore and the value was at ₹4.66 lakh crore.

320.title: 14 people, including 3 kids, injured in Chicago drive-by shooting
320.article_body: At least 14 people, including three children, were injured in a drive-by shooting on Monday night in the Garfield Park neighbourhood of US' Chicago, police said. The youngest victim was a three-year-old, Chicago Police chief informed. A preliminary probe indicated the involvement of at least two shooters, he added. No suspects have been identified yet, police said late on Monday.

321.title: We haven't purchased Russian oil directly: Sri Lanka Energy Minister
321.article_body: Sri Lankan Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera has said his country had been buying Russian oil through trading companies in Dubai and Singapore, but not directly from Russia. "We have requested the Russian government for assistance for energy security for Sri Lanka. We have had positive responses but so far no direct supplies," Wijesekera added.

322.title: 1 killed in Russian missile attack in Mykolaiv, apartment building demolished
322.article_body: Russia fired four missiles into Mykolaiv, in southern Ukraine, killing one person and demolishing an apartment building. This comes a day after Russia launched missile attacks on several cities including the capital Kyiv. Russian President Vladimir Putin said that the strikes and decision to suspend grain deal were in response to Ukraine's drone attack on Moscow's fleet in Crimea.

323.title: Video shows dog running with human head in its mouth in Mexico, police pull it out
323.article_body: A dog was filmed in Zacatecas, Mexico, running down the street with a human head hanging out of its mouth. The head and other body parts were abandoned in an automatic teller booth with a message referring to a drug cartel, an official told Fox News. Police were eventually able to pull the head out of the dog's mouth.

324.title: Hyderabad Pride March to be held on November 13 after gap of 3 years
324.article_body: Hyderabad city's Pride March, known as 'Hyderabad Queer Swabhimana Yatra', will be held after a gap of three years on November 13. The city first witnessed the rainbow parade in 2013. Over a thousand individuals are expected to attend the event. The organiser said the event has no rules on attire.

325.title: There wasn't much pressure on him: Afridi on Kohli's dropped catch vs SA
325.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli dropping Aiden Markram's catch in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against South Africa, Shahid Afridi said, "I don't think there was much pressure on Kohli during that catch." "[Teams] seem to be focussing more on their batting and bowling but fielding wins you 70% of games," added Afridi. South Africa defeated India by five wickets.

326.title: Result of massive corruption: Kejriwal on Morbi bridge collapse
326.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said the Morbi bridge collapse in Gujarat was a result of massive corruption and prayed for those who lost their lives in the incident. "Why was a watchmaking company which had no experience of bridge construction allowed to do so?" Kejriwal questioned. He demanded the resignation of Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel after the incident.

327.title: AAP contesting Gujarat polls to help BJP: Jairam Ramesh
327.article_body: Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh alleged that Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is contesting elections in Gujarat to help BJP. AAP entered the fray to cut into Congress votes, he further said. "The way AAP leaders are campaigning and raising issues, we see no difference between BJP and AAP. The two parties are engaged in shadowboxing," he said.

328.title: Mumbai Fire Brigade receives 4 ISO certifications for performance & service
328.article_body: The Mumbai Fire Brigade (MFB) has received four certifications from the International Organisation for Standardisation (ISO) for its performance and service, becoming India's first and only such authority to acquire them. The MFB has received certifications in four different parameters. "The brigade's performance will be recorded as per...international standards," Chief Fire Officer of MFB said.

329.title: MTNL and BSNL aim to raise $2.34 billion: Report
329.article_body: MTNL and BSNL are reportedly planning to raise an aggregate of ₹193.56 billion ($2.34 billion) through government-guaranteed bonds. MTNL plans to raise ₹109.10 billion in November. The telecom company is looking to issue bonds maturing in 10 years and will pay a semi-annual coupon. MTNL will meet bankers and investors on Tuesday, according to the report.

330.title: Stubble burning cases in H'yana not even 10% of Punjab's: CM Khattar
330.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said that the cases of stubble burning in Haryana are not even 10% of that in Punjab. "Last year, there were 2,561 incidents of stubble burning whereas it decreased to 1,925 this year. While 13,873 incidents have taken place in Punjab this year," Khattar added while addressing a press conference in Chandigarh.

331.title: Over 3,000 law students get incorrect marksheets, MU says 'technical glitch'
331.article_body: Over 3,000 law students who graduated from Mumbai University have received their final year marksheets with the wrong Permanent Roll Number (PRN), jeopardising their future plans. "I applied for an LLM course at another college. During the marksheet verification process, I was told my PRN was invalid," said a student. The university claimed that the error was a "technical glitch".

332.title: Kerala airport halts flights for 5 hrs for 'God's passage' through runway
332.article_body: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport closed its runway and halted flight operations for five hours from 4 pm to 9 pm on Tuesday to enable the smooth passage of the procession of Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple. The airport has been halting flight operations twice every year for decades for the bi-annual ceremonial procession that passes through the runway.

333.title: 18 persons cheated of ₹10,000 each on the pretext of job offers in Noida
333.article_body: As many as 18 persons have been cheated of at least ₹10,000 each on the pretext of getting jobs at a mobile company in Noida, police said. On Sunday, the victims submitted a complaint at the Sector 20 police station against the suspects, police added. "We have also inquired about the said company in Surajpur," police further said.

334.title: Doing a biopic on Sonia Gandhi would be interesting: Mahima Chaudhry
334.article_body: Actress Mahima Chaudhry, who will soon feature in Kangana Ranaut's directorial 'Emergency', has said that doing a biopic on former Congress President Sonia Gandhi would be interesting. "Her journey notably from Italy to India, and then becoming a political figure," Mahima further stated. The 'Pardes' actress will play the role of writer and activist Pupul Jayakar in 'Emergency'.

335.title: Tesla may begin mass production of Cybertruck by 2023 end: Report
335.article_body: Tesla is reportedly aiming to begin mass production of its pick-up truck, Cybertruck, by the end of 2023. The Cybertruck was unveiled in 2019 by Elon Musk, and last month Tesla said that it would be readying its Austin, Texas plant for its early production. In January, Musk pushed the launch of Cybertruck to 2023, citing shortages in sourcing components.

336.title: Cong to take out yatras in states not covered by Rahul's march: Jairam
336.article_body: The Congress party is organising Bharat Jodo Yatras in states not covered by the main walkathon led by party leader Rahul Gandhi, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said on Tuesday. He announced this during the Bharat Jodo Yatra which entered Hyderabad today. "In the next few days yatras will also be undertaken in Bihar and Jharkhand," Jairam said.

337.title: Chhattisgarh CM inaugurates tribal dance fest, shares pics & videos
337.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel inaugurated the third edition of the National Tribal Dance Festival in Raipur today. The state CM's Office also shared pictures and videos of the festival on Twitter, some of which were of artists parading to the tune of the song 'Sare Jahan Se Achha Hindustan Hamara'. This comes as the state celebrates its foundation day today.

338.title: Tata to add 45,000 women workers at iPhone plant in Tamil Nadu: Report
338.article_body: Tata Group is reportedly planning to hire 45,000 women workers at its electronics factory, that makes iPhone components in Tamil Nadu's Hosur, in 18 to 24 months. Tata Group is reportedly in talks with Wistron to build an electronics manufacturing joint venture, seeking to assemble iPhones in India. Tata had established the plant with an investment of ₹5,000 crore.

339.title: Pics show personal belongings of people crushed to death in S Korea stampede
339.article_body: Pictures of the personal belongings of those who were crushed to death during the Halloween stampede in South Korea's Seoul have been released. The items include shoes, jackets and items of clothing as well as masks, belts and toys. Around 150 people, most in their teens and twenties, died in the stampede recently.

340.title: Actor Prateik Babbar gets blue belt in Brazilian jiu-jitsu
340.article_body: Prateik Babbar recently won a blue belt in Brazilian jiu-jitsu. The actor, who has been training for about four years, said, "If there's...lull period in my life, MMA gives me balance...I think it's fuel for my soul. This is something I want to do for...rest of my life." Prateik added his ultimate goal is to become a black belt holder.

341.title: Pak's batting is always a problem, it's never solid enough: De Villiers
341.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers said Pakistan's batting has "always" been a problem, adding that it is "never" solid enough. "It always goes up and down," stated De Villiers. Pakistan recently suffered a defeat against Zimbabwe in a T20 World Cup 2022 match. Discussing the loss, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq had said, "Our batters were beaten at least 40 times."

342.title: Putin's hands 'stained in blood': Ukraine seeks Russia's expulsion from G20
342.article_body: Russia should be expelled from the G20 and President Vladimir Putin's invitation to a summit in Bali next month must be revoked, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry Spokesperson said. "Putin publicly acknowledged ordering missile strikes on Ukrainian civilians and energy infrastructure. With his hands stained in blood, he mustn't be allowed to sit at the table with world leaders," Oleg Nikolenko added.

343.title: When PM Modi goes abroad he receives great honour: Gehlot
343.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday said when PM Narendra Modi goes abroad, he receives great honour. "He's PM of the nation of Gandhi, where democracy is deep-rooted. When the world realises this, they feel proud that the PM of that country is coming to them," Gehlot added. Gehlot and PM Modi attended an event in Rajasthan today.

344.title: Woman mowed down by bus in Delhi while trying to cross road
344.article_body: A 27-year-old woman was run over by a bus while she was trying to cross a road in Delhi's Karol Bagh. The entire incident was captured on CCTV. The incident happened when the deceased Sapna, who worked as a receptionist, was heading towards her workplace. "We have seized the bus and are looking for bus owner and driver," police said.

345.title: Rescue operation underway for 3rd day in Morbi bridge collapse site
345.article_body: The rescue operation after the collapse of a suspension bridge in Gujarat's Morbi continued for the third day on Tuesday. At least 135 people died and several others were injured in the incident that took place on Sunday. NDRF said that 12 boats along with a team of 125 people have been deployed at the spot.

346.title: Nykaa shares surge as Q2 net profit rises by 333%, revenue up by 39%
346.article_body: Nykaa parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures reported a 333% surge in September-quarter net profit at ₹5.2 crore as against ₹1.17 crore a year earlier. The company's quarterly revenue from operations recorded a 39% year-on-year increase to ₹1,230.8 crore. At 3:17 pm, the stock was trading 2.88% higher at ₹1,186/piece on NSE. Last week, its stock had tumbled below the ₹1,000 mark.

347.title: Rajinikanth to attend Puneeth Rajkumar's Karnataka Ratna award ceremony
347.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth arrived in Bengaluru to attend an event organised by the Karnataka government to posthumously honour late actor Puneeth Rajkumar with the Karnataka Ratna award. The award is the highest civilian honour conferred by the state. Around 5,000 people are expected to arrive for the event, which will take place on Tuesday evening.

348.title: Sanjay Dutt to star in horror comedy 'The Vir-gin Tree'
348.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt is all set to star in a horror comedy movie, titled 'The Vir-gin Tree'. The movie will be produced by Sanjay's Three Dimension Motion Pictures Pvt Ltd and Deepak Mukut's Soham Rockstar Entertainment. In addition to Sanjay, 'The Vir-gin Tree' will also star Sunny Singh, Mouni Roy and Palak Tiwari among others in pivotal roles.
