349.title: No police officer who commits wrongs should be protected: Kerala CM
349.article_body: No police officer who commits wrongs should be protected, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said on Tuesday adding that such a stand would ensure that everyone worked honestly and without fear. Speaking on the occasion of Kerala Police Formation Day, the CM said there were isolated incidents of police personnel or officers indulging in activities which were wrong.

350.title: 24-year-old woman gang-raped at burial ground in Hyderabad
350.article_body: Two men were arrested in Hyderabad on Monday, hours after they allegedly raped a 24-year-old woman at a burial ground in Ghulam Murtuza Chawni. Ibrahim Baig and Mirza Omer Baig had run away from the scene after committing the crime. Locals took the victim to a police station. The accused were booked under Sections 376D and 376(2)(l) of the IPC.

351.title: US SC rejects Turkey's plea to quash lawsuits over 2017 brawl
351.article_body: The US Supreme Court on Monday dismissed Turkey's plea to quash civil lawsuits in US courts pertaining to a violent brawl outside the Turkish ambassador's residence in Washington on May 16, 2017. The incident took place during a visit by Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. Erdogan's bodyguards were accused of attacking protesters critical of his government, without any provocation.

352.title: Musk wears ₹6 lakh Halloween costume, people confused about his inspiration
352.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk wore a leather costume for Halloween that is available for $7,500 (over ₹6 lakh) online. The costume was listed as 'Devil's Champion' on a website. After Musk shared his pictures on Twitter, several people couldn't identify whether he was dressed as a known character or who was the inspiration behind his costume.

353.title: Surrogacy has become a big deal as some actors tried it: Varalaxmi
353.article_body: Actress Varalaxmi Sarathkumar said that surrogacy has become a "big deal for buzz as some of the actors have tried it". She also clarified that her upcoming film 'Yashoda' talks about surrogacy but doesn't "mention its good or bad effects". She will be seen playing the head of a surrogacy facility centre in 'Yashoda', which also stars Samantha Ruth Prabhu.

354.title: 23,547 autorickshaws, taxis in Mumbai fined for refusing passengers in Oct
354.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police (MTP) has fined 23,547 autorickshaws and taxis for refusing short-distance rides in October. Out of these cases, 15,395 autorickshaws were fined ₹50 each, and 8,152 taxis were fined ₹200 each. Earlier this month, MTP issued a notice stating action would be taken against autorickshaws and taxis that refuse to accept customers based on the fare and distance.

355.title: Zimbabwe are a lot better mentally than some of the big teams: Raza
355.article_body: Zimbabwe middle-order batter Sikandar Raza said Zimbabwe are in a "lot better place" mentally in comparison to some of the big teams competing in the T20 World Cup 2022. "We're not going in there to...merely exist...We're going to bring our brand of cricket...and see what happens," added Raza. Zimbabwe will next face Netherlands in the T20 World Cup 2022.

356.title: Gas leak at factory in Ludhiana, 5 persons left unconscious
356.article_body: A carbon dioxide leak at a factory in Ludhiana's Giaspura left five persons unconscious on Tuesday morning, police said. "The leaked gas formed a thick layer in the air and reduced visibility. Five workers in the adjoining unit fainted after inhaling the gas," an official said. The incident occurred when liquid carbon dioxide was being transferred from a tanker.

357.title: Gurugram hospital booked for operating without fire safety clearance
357.article_body: A private hospital named World Laparoscopy Hospital in DLF Phase-2, Gurugram was booked for allegedly functioning without a fire safety clearance and occupancy certificate. An FIR was filed on the directions of a city court after a complaint was made by the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram. However, the hospital said that they are in the process of getting the certificates.

358.title: Suniel bought half of my film's tickets as they were unsold: Jackie
358.article_body: Actor Jackie Shroff, who appeared on KBC 13 with Suniel Shetty, recalled an incident when Suniel had bought half of his film's tickets as they were unsold. "Someone...told us, 'Jackie, all the tickets of your new release haven't been sold yet'...[Suniel] said, 'Buy all the unsold tickets. His movie should have a full audience'," Jackie stated.

359.title: Cong President Mallikarjun Kharge to join Bharat Jodo Yatra in Hyderabad
359.article_body: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge will be joining Bharat Jodo Yatra in Hyderabad this evening, the first time he will do so after becoming the party President. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and Kharge will hoist the tricolour near the Charminar at the same spot where former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi hoisted the flag in the 1980s.

360.title: I remove my shoes when I go to meet well-wishers, it's a devotion for me: Big B
360.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, in his latest blog post, said that he removes his shoes when he goes to meet his well-wishers. He said that meeting his well-wishers is a devotion for him. In one of the pictures shared on his blog post, the actor can be seen removing his footwear. He also spoke about the crowd outside his house.

361.title: Some Pak players would sneak out & eat burgers: Afridi on attitude to fitness
361.article_body: Discussing the attitude of some Pakistan players towards fitness, ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said, "I know a few players who were called by PCB to the High Performance Centre...[for] their diet and training." "However...they [would]...sneak out to eat burgers," added Afridi. "If [players] are not serious about their fitness...PCB can't keep an eye...all the time," he stated.

362.title: US Prez Biden, First Lady host their first Halloween at White House
362.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden on Monday welcomed trick-or-treaters to the White House to celebrate Halloween. It was the Bidens' first time welcoming trick-or-treaters as President and First Lady. Biden wore a navy raincoat and baseball cap, while Jill was dressed in butterfly wings and a purple wig. The treats included chocolate kisses and candy bars.

363.title: Salman is a family guy, respects his parents so much: Sooraj Barjatya
363.article_body: Director Sooraj Barjatya said that Salman Khan might project being someone else, but essentially, he's "a family guy". "He's that elder son who loves his brothers, sisters and respects his parents," Barjatya mentioned, adding that he has never seen someone "more respectful than him". He also confirmed that he has written a version of his family drama with Salman.

364.title: No team can be taken lightly: Dravid ahead of India-Bangladesh T20 WC game
364.article_body: Ahead of India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup Super 12 stage match, India head coach Rahul Dravid said no team can be taken lightly. "At times, it's two hits here and two there. These conditions have made the contest a level-playing field. The grounds are big," he stated. Match will be played on Wednesday. India lost their last match against South Africa.

365.title: 50 nations condemn China's crimes against Uyghurs in Xinjiang
365.article_body: Fifty countries have signed a statement condemning China's crimes against Uyghurs in Xinjiang region. The signatories, including US, Britain, Japan, France, and Somalia among others, called for UN's "urgent attention" against China's treatment of Uyghurs. In August, a UN report said that China was committing serious human rights violations in Xinjiang under anti-extremism policies.

366.title: Chinese billionaire Wu Yajun quits as chairperson from her firm amid real estate crisis
366.article_body: Wu Yajun, the 58-year-old billionaire co-founder of Beijing-based property developer Longfor Properties, has resigned as the chairperson of the company amid the real estate crisis in China. Meanwhile, in an exchange filing, the company said that she stepped down due to health and age reasons. Notably, Yajun topped the Hurun Richest Self-Made Women in the World 2022 list.

367.title: Piyush Goyal condoles demise of Jamshed J Irani, calls him 'changemaker'
367.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday condoled the demise of Dr Jamshed J Irani, widely known as the 'Steel Man of India', who passed away aged 86 in Jamshedpur late Monday night. Goyal said, "Padma Bhushan...Jamshed J Irani was a changemaker, who helped build trust for Brand India globally." Irani served as the Managing Director of Tata Steel from 1992-2001.

368.title: Salman Khan gets Y+ security cover after threats, X category for Akshay Kumar: Reports
368.article_body: Mumbai Police will provide Y+ security cover to actor Salman Khan. The step has been taken by the state government after he received a threat letter from Lawrence Bishnoi gang earlier, said Maharashtra Police. Actor Akshay Kumar has also been reportedly given X-category security cover. According to reports, Akshay was granted security because of social media threats over his nationality.

369.title: State transport bus Shivshahi catches fire in Pune's Yerawada, video surfaces
369.article_body: State transport bus Shivshahi caught fire in Pune's Yerawada on Tuesday. A video of the incident was shared by Free Press Journal. Reports said that all of the 42 passengers of the bus are safe. The incident took place when the passengers were out of the bus and it was parked on the side of the road.

370.title: India are here to win World Cup, we aren't here to win it: Shakib Al Hasan
370.article_body: Ahead of India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup 2022 clash, Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan said that India are here to win the World Cup, adding that they are the favourites. "We aren't here to win the World Cup. If we beat them then it will be an upset. We will try to create an upset," he added.

371.title: Who is Sriram Krishnan, the engineer helping Elon Musk at Twitter?
371.article_body: Indian American investor, technologist and engineer Sriram Krishnan is temporarily helping out Twitter's new owner Elon Musk with making changes to the micro-blogging site. Krishnan, who did his B.Tech from SRM Engineering College in Tamil Nadu, has previously worked at Facebook, Snap, and Twitter. He's a General Partner at a16z, the firm which invested in Musk's buyout of Twitter.

372.title: Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain good friend of conman Sukesh: BJP
372.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra alleged that Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain is a good friend of conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. Patra also alleged that Jain used to regularly meet Chandrasekhar in Tihar Jail. Jain's secretary told the conman that he needs to pay ₹2 crore every month for basic facilities inside the prison, the BJP leader further alleged.

373.title: Maruti Suzuki sees 21% rise in Oct sales, 1,67,520 units sold last month
373.article_body: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki India on Tuesday reported a 21% increase in its total sales in October 2022, as 1,67,520 units were sold in the last month. It had sold 1,38,335 units in the same month last year. While the company's overall domestic passenger vehicle sales rose 26% in October, its sale of compact vehicles rose to 73,685 units.

374.title: PM Modi declares Rajasthan's Mangarh Dham a national monument
374.article_body: PM Narendra Modi declared Rajasthan's Mangarh Dham a national monument. PM paid tributes to tribals who were massacred by the British army in 1913 in Mangarh. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel and Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan were present at the event. "Mangarh is a shared heritage of people of Rajasthan, Maharashtra, MP...Gujarat," PM Modi said.

375.title: Anil was told he's ruining his career with 'Mr India': Boney Kapoor
375.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor revealed that people told Anil Kapoor that 'Mr India' would ruin his career as he would be invisible in major portions of the film. "I had faith...I told Anil that you'll be remembered as Mr India till your last breath," Boney added. The filmmaker further added that he was "broke" after the completion of the film.

376.title: Mother allegedly kills her 10-day-old boy in Karnataka's Mangaluru; booked
376.article_body: A woman has been booked in Karnataka’s Mangaluru for allegedly throwing her 10-day-old baby boy into a well. The accused has been identified as Pavithra, who was suffering from post-natal depression. She wanted to have a baby girl. However, when she had a boy, she was reportedly upset and killed the infant as her wish was not fulfilled.

377.title: Rahul is fantastic, I & Rohit have no doubt over who'll open: Dravid
377.article_body: Rahul Dravid said India opener KL Rahul is a "fantastic" player, adding that he's confident about Rahul making a strong comeback. Dravid stated that he and Rohit Sharma have "no doubt" over the other opener barring Rohit. "I know how much impact Rahul can make," he said. Rahul has scored 22 runs in the T20 World Cup 2022 so far.

378.title: Rohith Vemula's mother joins Bharat Jodo Yatra, meets Rahul Gandhi
378.article_body: On day 55 of the Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra, party MP Rahul Gandhi met the mother of Rohith Vemula, a Dalit student of the University of Hyderabad who died by suicide in 2016 after an episode of alleged harassment. She showed her support by walking briefly with Rahul Gandhi during the morning leg of the yatra in Telangana’s Shamshabad.

379.title: Impossible for any auto firm to be profitable in 1st yr: MG Motor India
379.article_body: Responding to the Corporate Affairs Ministry's notice to MG Motor India regarding its operational losses in 2019-2020, the automaker said, "It is impossible for any automobile company to be profitable in the very first year of its operations." Ministry had reportedly started the probe after an analysis of the automaker's statements that indicated suspicious transactions and other irregularities.

380.title: I know if I eat a paratha, coach will make me pay for it in training the next day: Neeraj
380.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, in a recent interview, said that he lost control after winning the gold medal at Olympics and gained weight. "Now I am controlling but in training...I know if I eat a paratha or something the coach will make me pay for it during training the next day," the 24-year-old said.

381.title: Son of ex-Punjab Police head constable arrested for murder in Chandigarh
381.article_body: Chandigarh Police arrested a 24-year-old man for allegedly killing a woman, whose body was recovered on October 28 behind the Sukhna Lake. The arrested man, Jagroop Singh, is the son of a late Punjab Police head constable, who passed away on duty last year, according to the police. Jagroop was purportedly in a relationship with the woman.

382.title: Twitter engineers asked to look at Vine's code for its revival: Report
382.article_body: Elon Musk's team has asked Twitter engineers to look into short video app Vine's code to see how much work it would take to revive it, media reports said citing sources. Musk started a Twitter poll on Sunday on whether he should bring back Vine. He has instructed engineers to work on a reboot that could be ready by year-end.

383.title: Unacceptable for ships to cross Black Sea after grain deal suspension: Russia
383.article_body: Russia has said it is "unacceptable" for ships to pass through Black Sea security corridor after it suspended participation in grain deal. The Russian Defence Ministry accused Ukraine of using security corridor to conduct military operations against Russia. It said there can be no question of guaranteeing security until Ukraine accepts obligation to not use Black Sea for military purposes.

384.title: Italian mafia kingpin wanted since 2015 captured in Argentina
384.article_body: Argentina's police have arrested a top Italian mobster wanted since 2015. Carmine Alfonso Maiorano, leader of the Italian 'Ndrangheta mafia, is accused by international authorities of carrying out drug trafficking and arms trafficking operations in Latin America and Europe. Interpol considers 'Ndrangheta as "one of the most extensive and powerful criminal organizations in the world".

385.title: Saudi Aramco's Q3 net income rises by 39% on higher crude prices
385.article_body: Saudi Arabian state oil producer, Saudi Aramco, reported a 39% rise in its third-quarter net income to $42.4 billion, led by higher crude oil prices and sales volume. Its free cash flow rose to $45 billion year-on-year from $28.7 billion. It also declared a dividend of $18.8 billion in the third quarter, which will be paid in the fourth quarter.

386.title: Singer AP Dhillon suffers injury during tour in US, shares pic from hospital
386.article_body: Singer AP Dhillon has been hospitalised after suffering an injury while on a tour in the US. Sharing a picture of his bandaged arm on Instagram, Dhillon announced that his shows in Los Angeles and San Francisco are being postponed. "I'm doing well and...expected to fully recover. However, I will not be able to perform at this time," he wrote.

387.title: Foxconn hikes daily bonuses by 4 times for staff amid COVID-19 curbs in China
387.article_body: After videos showed workers escaping from iPhone maker Foxconn’s Zhengzhou plant in China amid COVID-19 restrictions, Foxconn has quadrupled bonuses to retain staff at the manufacturing site. According to the WeChat account of Foxconn's Zhengzhou plant, daily bonuses for employees have been raised to 400 yuan for November from 100 yuan. Foxconn produces 70% of iPhone shipments globally.

388.title: I lost control after Olympics and gained weight: Neeraj Chopra
388.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, in a recent interview, said that he lost control after winning the gold medal at Olympics and gained weight. "Now I am controlling but in training...I know if I eat a paratha or something the coach will make me pay for it during training the next day," the 24-year-old said.

389.title: Europeans ask me if Indians have to return the money parents spend on raising them: Neeraj
389.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, in an interview, said people in Europe ask him if Indians have to return the money parents spend on raising them after they start earning. "I tell them it’s different here. I think it’s only in our culture that even after growing up we live with our parents as kids," Neeraj said.

390.title: SaaS startup Icertis raises $150 million from Silicon Valley Bank
390.article_body: Software-as-a-service (SaaS) startup Icertis has secured $150 million through revolving credit facility and convertible debt from US-based Silicon Valley Bank. After the latest funding round, the company's total capital has reached $520 million. The company was co-founded by former Aztecsoft CEO Samir Bodas and former BladeLogic executive Monish Darda in 2009.

391.title: Couple, maid found dead under mysterious circumstances in Delhi
391.article_body: A couple and their maid were found dead at their residence in Delhi's Hari Nagar area under mysterious circumstances, police said on Tuesday. The CCTV footage of the area is being analysed to identify the culprits and a murder case has been filed, according to the police. Officials said that the couple's two-year-old daughter was found safe, according to reports.

392.title: 2 men stab dog to death after it constantly barks at them for days in MP
392.article_body: Two men aged between 20 and 25 years stabbed a stray dog to death using a knife in Madhya Pradesh. The two said that the dog had been constantly barking at them for days. An official said that the two accused got angry after the dog barked at them again on Sunday night. The dog died on the spot.

393.title: Didn't sleep, helped people entire night: Eyewitness of Morbi bridge collapse
393.article_body: An eyewitness to Gujarat's Morbi bridge collapse incident said that he saw people hanging from cables and then slipping down. The eyewitness, who sells tea near the bridge every Sunday, said, "I didn't sleep and helped people the entire night. It was heart-wrenching to see a 7-8-month-pregnant woman die. Never saw anything like that in my life," he added.

394.title: Police destroy 400 kg of drugs seized in 133 cases in Ambala
394.article_body: Police have destroyed 400 kg of drugs which had been seized in 133 cases at a waste management unit in Haryana's Ambala on Monday. The drugs included 2.98 kg of chura post, 91.8 kg of ganja, 900 gm of heroin, 1.5 kg of sulfa, 10 gm of charas and several intoxicant capsules, tablets, injections and syrups, a police spokesperson said.

395.title: Was forced to pay ₹10 cr to AAP's Satyendar Jain as 'protection money': Conman Sukesh
395.article_body: In a letter to Delhi L-G VK Saxena, jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar has alleged that he was forced to pay ₹10 crore to Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Satyendar Jain as "protection money". Sukesh said that a total amount of ₹50 crore was paid to the AAP as he was promised an important party position in south India.

396.title: Video of monkey drinking beer near UP liquor shop goes viral; shopkeepers file complaint
396.article_body: A video showing monkey drinking beer near a liquor shop in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli is going viral on social media. The liquor shopkeepers in the region complained against the monkey accusing it of stealing alcohol from their shops and also snatching bottles from their customers. District Excise Officer Rajendra Pratap Singh said efforts are being made to catch the monkey.

397.title: GST collections rise to ₹1.52 lakh crore in October, 2nd highest ever
397.article_body: India collected ₹1.52 lakh crore in Goods and Services Tax (GST) in October, marking the second-highest monthly collection ever after that in April 2022, the Finance Ministry said. The monthly GST revenues have been over ₹1.40 lakh crore for eight straight months. In October, central GST was ₹26,039 crore, state GST was ₹33,396 crore and integrated GST was ₹81,778 crore.

398.title: Toyota Motor's Q2 profit falls by 25%, FY output target cut to 9.2 mn
398.article_body: Toyota Motor reported a 25% fall in second-quarter operating profit to 562.7 billion yen ($3.79 billion) as against a 749.9-billion yen profit in the corresponding period last year. Toyota said last week that its global production rebounded by 30% in the September quarter. However, it cut its fiscal output target to 9.2 million vehicles on continuing risks to chip supply.

399.title: 4 sickened by carbon dioxide release at Los Angeles airport
399.article_body: Four people, a woman and three men, were sickened by a release of carbon dioxide in a Los Angeles International Airport utility room on Monday. All people hurt in the incident were airport employees and one man is in grave condition, officials said. "The carbon dioxide displaced the oxygen in his bloodstream and he went into cardiac arrest," they said.

400.title: India reports 1,046 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 17,618
400.article_body: India reported 1,046 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,326 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 17,618. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,29,077 following 53 casualties in the last 24 hours.

401.title: Afghanistan crash out of T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals race after losing to Sri Lanka
401.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Afghanistan by six wickets in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage Group 1 match on Tuesday. Afghanistan put up a total of 144/8 in their 20 overs, with Sri Lanka chasing down the target in 18.3 overs. With this, Afghanistan have crashed out of the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals race.

402.title: Google pauses Play Store billing in India after ₹936-crore fine by CCI
402.article_body: Google has paused its plans to enforce the Play billing system on Indian developers from October 31 following the ruling by the Competition Commission of India. CCI imposed two fines on Google, one worth ₹936.44 crore for abusing its dominant position in reference to Play Store policies and the second for ₹1,338 crore for abusing dominance in Android device market.

403.title: Stuff of dreams: Satwik after winning historic Super 750 title with Chirag
403.article_body: Reacting to becoming the first Indian doubles pair to win a Super 750 title alongside Chirag Shetty, Satwiksairaj Rankireddy took to Instagram to share, "I am thrilled beyond words and humbled beyond comparison!" "[It] is definitely the stuff of dreams! But not a moment longer to rest on our laurels, bigger goals [and] bigger titles are ahead," added Satwiksairaj.
